  7560             }
  7561         }
  7562 
  7563       if (find_composition (end, limit, &start, &end, &prop,
  7564                             coding->src_object)
  7565           && end <= limit)
  7566         *stop = start;
  7567       else
  7568         *stop = limit;
  7569     }
  7570   return buf;
  7571 }
  7572 
  7573 
  7574 /* Extract an annotation datum from a text property `charset' at POS of
  7575    CODING->src_object (buffer of string), store the data in BUF, set
  7576    *STOP to the position where the value of `charset' property changes
  7577    (limiting by LIMIT), and return the address of the next element of
  7578    BUF.
  7579 
  7580    If the property value is nil, set *STOP to the position where the
  7581    property value is non-nil (limiting by LIMIT), and return BUF.  */
  7582 
  7583 static int *
  7584 handle_charset_annotation (ptrdiff_t pos, ptrdiff_t limit,
  7585                            struct coding_system *coding, int *buf,
  7586                            ptrdiff_t *stop)
  7587 {
  7588   Lisp_Object val, next;
  7589   int id;
  7590 
  7591   val = Fget_text_property (make_fixnum (pos), Qcharset, coding->src_object);
  7592   if (! NILP (val) && CHARSETP (val))
  7593     id = XFIXNUM (CHARSET_SYMBOL_ID (val));
  7594   else
  7595     id = -1;
  7596   ADD_CHARSET_DATA (buf, 0, id);
  7597   next = Fnext_single_property_change (make_fixnum (pos), Qcharset,
  7598                                        coding->src_object,
  7599                                        make_fixnum (limit));
  7600   *stop = XFIXNUM (next);
  7601   return buf;
  7602 }
  7603 
  7604 
  7605 static void
  7606 consume_chars (struct coding_system *coding, Lisp_Object translation_table,
  7607                int max_lookup)
  7608 {
  7609   int *buf = coding->charbuf;
  7610   int *buf_end = coding->charbuf + coding->charbuf_size;
  7611   const unsigned char *src = coding->source + coding->consumed;
  7612   const unsigned char *src_end = coding->source + coding->src_bytes;
  7613   ptrdiff_t pos = coding->src_pos + coding->consumed_char;
  7614   ptrdiff_t end_pos = coding->src_pos + coding->src_chars;
  7615   bool multibytep = coding->src_multibyte;
  7616   Lisp_Object eol_type;
  7617   int c;
  7618   ptrdiff_t stop, stop_composition, stop_charset;
  7619   int *lookup_buf = NULL;
  7620 
  7621   if (! NILP (translation_table))
  7622     lookup_buf = alloca (sizeof (int) * max_lookup);
  7623 
  7624   eol_type = inhibit_eol_conversion ? Qunix : CODING_ID_EOL_TYPE (coding->id);
  7625   if (VECTORP (eol_type))
  7626     eol_type = Qunix;
  7627 
  7628   /* Note: composition handling is not yet implemented.  */
  7629   coding->common_flags &= ~CODING_ANNOTATE_COMPOSITION_MASK;
  7630 
  7631   if (NILP (coding->src_object))
  7632     stop = stop_composition = stop_charset = end_pos;
  7633   else
  7634     {
  7635       if (coding->common_flags & CODING_ANNOTATE_COMPOSITION_MASK)
  7636         stop = stop_composition = pos;
  7637       else
  7638         stop = stop_composition = end_pos;
  7639       if (coding->common_flags & CODING_ANNOTATE_CHARSET_MASK)
  7640         stop = stop_charset = pos;
  7641       else
  7642         stop_charset = end_pos;
  7643     }
  7644 
  7645   /* Compensate for CRLF and conversion.  */
  7646   buf_end -= 1 + MAX_ANNOTATION_LENGTH;
  7647   while (buf < buf_end)
  7648     {
  7649       Lisp_Object trans;
  7650 
  7651       if (pos == stop)
  7652         {
  7653           if (pos == end_pos)
  7654             break;
  7655           if (pos == stop_composition)
  7656             buf = handle_composition_annotation (pos, end_pos, coding,
  7657                                                  buf, &stop_composition);
  7658           if (pos == stop_charset)
  7659             buf = handle_charset_annotation (pos, end_pos, coding,
  7660                                              buf, &stop_charset);
  7661           stop = (stop_composition < stop_charset
  7662                   ? stop_composition : stop_charset);
  7663         }
  7664 
  7665       if (! multibytep)
  7666         {
  7667           if (coding->encoder == encode_coding_raw_text
  7668               || coding->encoder == encode_coding_ccl)
  7669             c = *src++, pos++;
  7670           else
  7671             {
  7672               int bytes = multibyte_length (src, src_end, true, true);
  7673               if (0 < bytes)
  7674                 c = STRING_CHAR_ADVANCE_NO_UNIFY (src), pos += bytes;
  7675               else
  7676                 c = BYTE8_TO_CHAR (*src), src++, pos++;
  7677             }
  7678         }
  7679       else
  7680         c = STRING_CHAR_ADVANCE_NO_UNIFY (src), pos++;
  7681       if ((c == '\r') && (coding->mode & CODING_MODE_SELECTIVE_DISPLAY))
  7682         c = '\n';
  7683       if (! EQ (eol_type, Qunix))
  7684         {
  7685           if (c == '\n')
  7686             {
  7687               if (EQ (eol_type, Qdos))
  7688                 *buf++ = '\r';
  7689               else
  7690                 c = '\r';
  7691             }
  7692         }
  7693 
  7694       trans = Qnil;
  7695       LOOKUP_TRANSLATION_TABLE (translation_table, c, trans);
  7696       if (NILP (trans))
  7697         *buf++ = c;
  7698       else
  7699         {
  7700           ptrdiff_t from_nchars = 1, to_nchars = 1;
  7701           int *lookup_buf_end;
  7702           const unsigned char *p = src;
  7703           int i;
  7704 
  7705           lookup_buf[0] = c;
  7706           for (i = 1; i < max_lookup && p < src_end; i++)
  7707             lookup_buf[i] = string_char_advance (&p);
  7708           lookup_buf_end = lookup_buf + i;
  7709           trans = get_translation (trans, lookup_buf, lookup_buf_end,
  7710                                    &from_nchars);
  7711           if (FIXNUMP (trans))
  7712             c = XFIXNUM (trans);
  7713           else if (VECTORP (trans))
  7714             {
  7715               to_nchars = ASIZE (trans);
  7716               if (buf_end - buf < to_nchars)
  7717                 break;
  7718               c = XFIXNUM (AREF (trans, 0));
  7719             }
  7720           else
  7721             break;
  7722           *buf++ = c;
  7723           for (i = 1; i < to_nchars; i++)
  7724             *buf++ = XFIXNUM (AREF (trans, i));
  7725           for (i = 1; i < from_nchars; i++, pos++)
  7726             src += multibyte_length (src, NULL, false, true);
  7727         }
  7728     }
  7729 
  7730   coding->consumed = src - coding->source;
  7731   coding->consumed_char = pos - coding->src_pos;
  7732   coding->charbuf_used = buf - coding->charbuf;
  7733   coding->chars_at_source = 0;
  7734 }
  7735 
  7736 
  7737 /* Encode the text at CODING->src_object into CODING->dst_object.
  7738    CODING->src_object is a buffer or a string.
  7739    CODING->dst_object is a buffer or nil.
  7740 
  7741    If CODING->src_object is a buffer, it must be the current buffer.
  7742    In this case, if CODING->src_pos is positive, it is a position of
  7743    the source text in the buffer, otherwise. the source text is in the
  7744    gap area of the buffer, and coding->src_pos specifies the offset of
  7745    the text from GPT (which must be the same as PT).  If this is the
  7746    same buffer as CODING->dst_object, CODING->src_pos must be
  7747    negative and CODING should not have `pre-write-conversion'.
  7748 
  7749    If CODING->src_object is a string, CODING should not have
  7750    `pre-write-conversion'.
  7751 
  7752    If CODING->dst_object is a buffer, the encoded data is inserted at
  7753    the current point of that buffer.
  7754 
  7755    If CODING->dst_object is nil, the encoded data is placed at the
  7756    memory area specified by CODING->destination.  */
  7757 
  7758 static void
  7759 encode_coding (struct coding_system *coding)
  7760 {
  7761   Lisp_Object attrs;
  7762   Lisp_Object translation_table;
  7763   int max_lookup;
  7764   struct ccl_spec cclspec;
  7765 
  7766   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
  7767 
  7768   attrs = CODING_ID_ATTRS (coding->id);
  7769   if (coding->encoder == encode_coding_raw_text)
  7770     translation_table = Qnil, max_lookup = 0;
  7771   else
  7772     translation_table = get_translation_table (attrs, 1, &max_lookup);
  7773 
  7774   if (BUFFERP (coding->dst_object))
  7775     {
  7776       set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (coding->dst_object));
  7777       coding->dst_multibyte
  7778         = ! NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters));
  7779     }
  7780 
  7781   coding->consumed = coding->consumed_char = 0;
  7782   coding->produced = coding->produced_char = 0;
  7783   record_conversion_result (coding, CODING_RESULT_SUCCESS);
  7784 
  7785   ALLOC_CONVERSION_WORK_AREA (coding, coding->src_chars);
  7786 
  7787   if (coding->encoder == encode_coding_ccl)
  7788     {
  7789       coding->spec.ccl = &cclspec;
  7790       setup_ccl_program (&cclspec.ccl, CODING_CCL_ENCODER (coding));
  7791     }
  7792   do {
  7793     coding_set_source (coding);
  7794     consume_chars (coding, translation_table, max_lookup);
  7795     coding_set_destination (coding);
  7796     /* The CODING_MODE_LAST_BLOCK flag should be set only for the last
  7797        iteration of the encoding.  */
  7798     unsigned saved_mode = coding->mode;
  7799     if (coding->consumed_char < coding->src_chars)
  7800       coding->mode &= ~CODING_MODE_LAST_BLOCK;
  7801     (*(coding->encoder)) (coding);
  7802     coding->mode = saved_mode;
  7803   } while (coding->consumed_char < coding->src_chars);
  7804 
  7805   if (BUFFERP (coding->dst_object) && coding->produced_char > 0)
  7806     insert_from_gap (coding->produced_char, coding->produced, 0);
  7807 
  7808   SAFE_FREE ();
  7809 }
  7810 
  7811 /* Code-conversion operations use internal buffers.  There's a single
  7812    reusable buffer, which is created the first time it is needed, and
  7813    then never killed.  When this reusable buffer is being used, the
  7814    reused_workbuf_in_use flag is set.  If we need another conversion
  7815    buffer while the reusable one is in use (e.g., if code-conversion
  7816    is reentered when another code-conversion is in progress), we
  7817    create temporary buffers using the name of the reusable buffer as
  7818    the base name, see code_conversion_save below.  These temporary
  7819    buffers are killed when the code-conversion operations that use
  7820    them return, see code_conversion_restore below.  */
  7821 
  7822 /* A string that serves as name of the reusable work buffer, and as base
  7823    name of temporary work buffers used for code-conversion operations.  */
  7824 static Lisp_Object Vcode_conversion_workbuf_name;
  7825 
  7826 /* The reusable working buffer, created once and never killed.  */
  7827 static Lisp_Object Vcode_conversion_reused_workbuf;
  7828 
  7829 /* True iff Vcode_conversion_reused_workbuf is already in use.  */
  7830 static bool reused_workbuf_in_use;
  7831 
  7832 static void
  7833 code_conversion_restore (Lisp_Object arg)
  7834 {
  7835   Lisp_Object current, workbuf;
  7836 
  7837   current = XCAR (arg);
  7838   workbuf = XCDR (arg);
  7839   if (! NILP (workbuf))
  7840     {
  7841       if (EQ (workbuf, Vcode_conversion_reused_workbuf))
  7842         reused_workbuf_in_use = false;
  7843       else
  7844         Fkill_buffer (workbuf);
  7845     }
  7846   set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (current));
  7847 }
  7848 
  7849 Lisp_Object
  7850 code_conversion_save (bool with_work_buf, bool multibyte)
  7851 {
  7852   Lisp_Object workbuf = Qnil;
  7853 
  7854   if (with_work_buf)
  7855     {
  7856       if (reused_workbuf_in_use)
  7857         {
  7858           Lisp_Object name
  7859             = Fgenerate_new_buffer_name (Vcode_conversion_workbuf_name, Qnil);
  7860           workbuf = Fget_buffer_create (name, Qt);
  7861         }
  7862       else
  7863         {
  7864           if (NILP (Fbuffer_live_p (Vcode_conversion_reused_workbuf)))
  7865             Vcode_conversion_reused_workbuf
  7866               = Fget_buffer_create (Vcode_conversion_workbuf_name, Qt);
  7867           workbuf = Vcode_conversion_reused_workbuf;
  7868         }
  7869     }
  7870   record_unwind_protect (code_conversion_restore,
  7871                          Fcons (Fcurrent_buffer (), workbuf));
  7872   if (!NILP (workbuf))
  7873     {
  7874       struct buffer *current = current_buffer;
  7875       set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (workbuf));
  7876       /* We can't allow modification hooks to run in the work buffer.  For
  7877          instance, directory_files_internal assumes that file decoding
  7878          doesn't compile new regexps.  */
  7879       Fset (Fmake_local_variable (Qinhibit_modification_hooks), Qt);
  7880       Ferase_buffer ();
  7881       bset_undo_list (current_buffer, Qt);
  7882       bset_enable_multibyte_characters (current_buffer, multibyte ? Qt : Qnil);
  7883       if (EQ (workbuf, Vcode_conversion_reused_workbuf))
  7884         reused_workbuf_in_use = true;
  7885       set_buffer_internal (current);
  7886     }
  7887 
  7888   return workbuf;
  7889 }
  7890 
  7891 static void
  7892 coding_restore_undo_list (Lisp_Object arg)
  7893 {
  7894   Lisp_Object undo_list = XCAR (arg);
  7895   struct buffer *buf = XBUFFER (XCDR (arg));
  7896 
  7897   bset_undo_list (buf, undo_list);
  7898 }
  7899 
  7900 /* Decode the *last* BYTES of the gap and insert them at point.  */
  7901 void
  7902 decode_coding_gap (struct coding_system *coding, ptrdiff_t bytes)
  7903 {
  7904   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  7905   Lisp_Object attrs;
  7906 
  7907   eassert (GPT_BYTE == PT_BYTE);
  7908 
  7909   coding->src_object = Fcurrent_buffer ();
  7910   coding->src_chars = bytes;
  7911   coding->src_bytes = bytes;
  7912   coding->src_pos = -bytes;
  7913   coding->src_pos_byte = -bytes;
  7914   coding->src_multibyte = false;
  7915   coding->dst_object = coding->src_object;
  7916   coding->dst_pos = PT;
  7917   coding->dst_pos_byte = PT_BYTE;
  7918   eassert (coding->dst_multibyte
  7919            == !NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters)));
  7920 
  7921   coding->head_ascii = -1;
  7922   coding->detected_utf8_bytes = coding->detected_utf8_chars = -1;
  7923   coding->eol_seen = EOL_SEEN_NONE;
  7924   if (CODING_REQUIRE_DETECTION (coding))
  7925     detect_coding (coding);
  7926   attrs = CODING_ID_ATTRS (coding->id);
  7927   if (! disable_ascii_optimization
  7928       && ! coding->src_multibyte
  7929       && ! NILP (CODING_ATTR_ASCII_COMPAT (attrs))
  7930       && NILP (CODING_ATTR_POST_READ (attrs))
  7931       && NILP (get_translation_table (attrs, 0, NULL)))
  7932     {
  7933       ptrdiff_t chars = coding->head_ascii;
  7934       if (chars < 0)
  7935         chars = check_ascii (coding);
  7936       if (chars != bytes)
  7937         {
  7938           /* There exists a non-ASCII byte.  */
  7939           if (EQ (CODING_ATTR_TYPE (attrs), Qutf_8)
  7940               && coding->detected_utf8_bytes == coding->src_bytes)
  7941             {
  7942               if (coding->detected_utf8_chars >= 0)
  7943                 chars = coding->detected_utf8_chars;
  7944               else
  7945                 chars = check_utf_8 (coding);
  7946               if (CODING_UTF_8_BOM (coding) != utf_without_bom
  7947                   && coding->head_ascii == 0
  7948                   && coding->source[0] == UTF_8_BOM_1
  7949                   && coding->source[1] == UTF_8_BOM_2
  7950                   && coding->source[2] == UTF_8_BOM_3)
  7951                 {
  7952                   chars--;
  7953                   bytes -= 3;
  7954                   coding->src_bytes -= 3;
  7955                 }
  7956             }
  7957           else
  7958             chars = -1;
  7959         }
  7960       if (chars >= 0)
  7961         {
  7962           Lisp_Object eol_type;
  7963 
  7964           eol_type = CODING_ID_EOL_TYPE (coding->id);
  7965           if (VECTORP (eol_type))
  7966             {
  7967               if (coding->eol_seen != EOL_SEEN_NONE)
  7968                 eol_type = adjust_coding_eol_type (coding, coding->eol_seen);
  7969             }
  7970           if (EQ (eol_type, Qmac))
  7971             {
  7972               unsigned char *src_end = GAP_END_ADDR;
  7973               unsigned char *src = src_end - coding->src_bytes;
  7974 
  7975               while (src < src_end)
  7976                 {
  7977                   if (*src++ == '\r')
  7978                     src[-1] = '\n';
  7979                 }
  7980             }
  7981           else if (EQ (eol_type, Qdos))
  7982             {
  7983               unsigned char *src = GAP_END_ADDR;
  7984               unsigned char *src_beg = src - coding->src_bytes;
  7985               unsigned char *dst = src;
  7986               ptrdiff_t diff;
  7987 
  7988               while (src_beg < src)
  7989                 {
  7990                   *--dst = *--src;
  7991                   if (*src == '\n' && src > src_beg && src[-1] == '\r')
  7992                     src--;
  7993                 }
  7994               diff = dst - src;
  7995               bytes -= diff;
  7996               chars -= diff;
  7997             }
  7998           coding->produced = bytes;
  7999           coding->produced_char = chars;
  8000           insert_from_gap (chars, bytes, 1);
  8001           return;
  8002         }
  8003     }
  8004   code_conversion_save (0, 0);
  8005 
  8006   coding->mode |= CODING_MODE_LAST_BLOCK;
  8007   current_buffer->text->inhibit_shrinking = 1;
  8008   decode_coding (coding);
  8009   current_buffer->text->inhibit_shrinking = 0;
  8010 
  8011   if (! NILP (CODING_ATTR_POST_READ (attrs)))
  8012     {
  8013       ptrdiff_t prev_Z = Z, prev_Z_BYTE = Z_BYTE;
  8014       Lisp_Object val;
  8015       Lisp_Object undo_list = BVAR (current_buffer, undo_list);
  8016 
  8017       record_unwind_protect (coding_restore_undo_list,
  8018                              Fcons (undo_list, Fcurrent_buffer ()));
  8019       bset_undo_list (current_buffer, Qt);
  8020       TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (coding->dst_pos, coding->dst_pos_byte);
  8021       val = call1 (CODING_ATTR_POST_READ (attrs),
  8022                    make_fixnum (coding->produced_char));
  8023       CHECK_FIXNAT (val);
  8024       coding->produced_char += Z - prev_Z;
  8025       coding->produced += Z_BYTE - prev_Z_BYTE;
  8026     }
  8027 
  8028   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  8029 }
  8030 
  8031 
  8032 /* Decode the text in the range FROM/FROM_BYTE and TO/TO_BYTE in
  8033    SRC_OBJECT into DST_OBJECT by coding context CODING.
  8034 
  8035    SRC_OBJECT is a buffer, a string, or Qnil.
  8036 
  8037    If it is a buffer, the text is at point of the buffer.  FROM and TO
  8038    are positions in the buffer.
  8039 
  8040    If it is a string, the text is at the beginning of the string.
  8041    FROM and TO are indices to the string.
  8042 
  8043    If it is nil, the text is at coding->source.  FROM and TO are
  8044    indices to coding->source.
  8045 
  8046    DST_OBJECT is a buffer, Qt, or Qnil.
  8047 
  8048    If it is a buffer, the decoded text is inserted at point of the
  8049    buffer.  If the buffer is the same as SRC_OBJECT, the source text
  8050    is deleted.
  8051 
  8052    If it is Qt, a string is made from the decoded text, and
  8053    set in CODING->dst_object.
  8054 
  8055    If it is Qnil, the decoded text is stored at CODING->destination.
  8056    The caller must allocate CODING->dst_bytes bytes at
  8057    CODING->destination by xmalloc.  If the decoded text is longer than
  8058    CODING->dst_bytes, CODING->destination is relocated by xrealloc.
  8059  */
  8060 
  8061 void
  8062 decode_coding_object (struct coding_system *coding,
  8063                       Lisp_Object src_object,
  8064                       ptrdiff_t from, ptrdiff_t from_byte,
  8065                       ptrdiff_t to, ptrdiff_t to_byte,
  8066                       Lisp_Object dst_object)
  8067 {
  8068   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  8069   unsigned char *destination UNINIT;
  8070   ptrdiff_t dst_bytes UNINIT;
  8071   ptrdiff_t chars = to - from;
  8072   ptrdiff_t bytes = to_byte - from_byte;
  8073   Lisp_Object attrs;
  8074   ptrdiff_t saved_pt = -1, saved_pt_byte UNINIT;
  8075   bool need_marker_adjustment = 0;
  8076   Lisp_Object old_deactivate_mark;
  8077 
  8078   old_deactivate_mark = Vdeactivate_mark;
  8079 
  8080   if (NILP (dst_object))
  8081     {
  8082       destination = coding->destination;
  8083       dst_bytes = coding->dst_bytes;
  8084     }
  8085 
  8086   coding->src_object = src_object;
  8087   coding->src_chars = chars;
  8088   coding->src_bytes = bytes;
  8089   coding->src_multibyte = chars < bytes;
  8090 
  8091   if (STRINGP (src_object))
  8092     {
  8093       coding->src_pos = from;
  8094       coding->src_pos_byte = from_byte;
  8095     }
  8096   else if (BUFFERP (src_object))
  8097     {
  8098       set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (src_object));
  8099       if (from != GPT)
  8100         move_gap_both (from, from_byte);
  8101       if (EQ (src_object, dst_object))
  8102         {
  8103           struct Lisp_Marker *tail;
  8104 
  8105           for (tail = BUF_MARKERS (current_buffer); tail; tail = tail->next)
  8106             {
  8107               tail->need_adjustment
  8108                 = tail->charpos == (tail->insertion_type ? from : to);
  8109               need_marker_adjustment |= tail->need_adjustment;
  8110             }
  8111           saved_pt = PT, saved_pt_byte = PT_BYTE;
  8112           TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (from, from_byte);
  8113           current_buffer->text->inhibit_shrinking = 1;
  8114           del_range_both (from, from_byte, to, to_byte, 1);
  8115           coding->src_pos = -chars;
  8116           coding->src_pos_byte = -bytes;
  8117         }
  8118       else
  8119         {
  8120           coding->src_pos = from;
  8121           coding->src_pos_byte = from_byte;
  8122         }
  8123     }
  8124 
  8125   if (CODING_REQUIRE_DETECTION (coding))
  8126     detect_coding (coding);
  8127   attrs = CODING_ID_ATTRS (coding->id);
  8128 
  8129   if (EQ (dst_object, Qt)
  8130       || (! NILP (CODING_ATTR_POST_READ (attrs))
  8131           && NILP (dst_object)))
  8132     {
  8133       coding->dst_multibyte = !CODING_FOR_UNIBYTE (coding);
  8134       coding->dst_object = code_conversion_save (1, coding->dst_multibyte);
  8135       coding->dst_pos = BEG;
  8136       coding->dst_pos_byte = BEG_BYTE;
  8137     }
  8138   else if (BUFFERP (dst_object))
  8139     {
  8140       code_conversion_save (0, 0);
  8141       coding->dst_object = dst_object;
  8142       coding->dst_pos = BUF_PT (XBUFFER (dst_object));
  8143       coding->dst_pos_byte = BUF_PT_BYTE (XBUFFER (dst_object));
  8144       coding->dst_multibyte
  8145         = ! NILP (BVAR (XBUFFER (dst_object), enable_multibyte_characters));
  8146     }
  8147   else
  8148     {
  8149       code_conversion_save (0, 0);
  8150       coding->dst_object = Qnil;
  8151       /* Most callers presume this will return a multibyte result, and they
  8152          won't use `binary' or `raw-text' anyway, so let's not worry about
  8153          CODING_FOR_UNIBYTE.  */
  8154       coding->dst_multibyte = 1;
  8155     }
  8156 
  8157   decode_coding (coding);
  8158 
  8159   if (BUFFERP (coding->dst_object))
  8160     set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (coding->dst_object));
  8161 
  8162   if (! NILP (CODING_ATTR_POST_READ (attrs)))
  8163     {
  8164       ptrdiff_t prev_Z = Z, prev_Z_BYTE = Z_BYTE;
  8165       Lisp_Object val;
  8166       Lisp_Object undo_list = BVAR (current_buffer, undo_list);
  8167       specpdl_ref count1 = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  8168 
  8169       record_unwind_protect (coding_restore_undo_list,
  8170                              Fcons (undo_list, Fcurrent_buffer ()));
  8171       bset_undo_list (current_buffer, Qt);
  8172       TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (coding->dst_pos, coding->dst_pos_byte);
  8173       val = safe_call1 (CODING_ATTR_POST_READ (attrs),
  8174                         make_fixnum (coding->produced_char));
  8175       CHECK_FIXNAT (val);
  8176       coding->produced_char += Z - prev_Z;
  8177       coding->produced += Z_BYTE - prev_Z_BYTE;
  8178       unbind_to (count1, Qnil);
  8179     }
  8180 
  8181   if (EQ (dst_object, Qt))
  8182     {
  8183       coding->dst_object = Fbuffer_string ();
  8184     }
  8185   else if (NILP (dst_object) && BUFFERP (coding->dst_object))
  8186     {
  8187       set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (coding->dst_object));
  8188       if (dst_bytes < coding->produced)
  8189         {
  8190           eassert (coding->produced > 0);
  8191           destination = xrealloc (destination, coding->produced);
  8192           if (BEGV < GPT && GPT < BEGV + coding->produced_char)
  8193             move_gap_both (BEGV, BEGV_BYTE);
  8194           memcpy (destination, BEGV_ADDR, coding->produced);
  8195           coding->destination = destination;
  8196         }
  8197     }
  8198 
  8199   if (saved_pt >= 0)
  8200     {
  8201       /* This is the case of:
  8202          (BUFFERP (src_object) && BASE_EQ (src_object, dst_object))
  8203          As we have moved PT while replacing the original buffer
  8204          contents, we must recover it now.  */
  8205       set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (src_object));
  8206       current_buffer->text->inhibit_shrinking = 0;
  8207       if (saved_pt < from)
  8208         TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (saved_pt, saved_pt_byte);
  8209       else if (saved_pt < from + chars)
  8210         TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (from, from_byte);
  8211       else if (! NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters)))
  8212         TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (saved_pt + (coding->produced_char - chars),
  8213                           saved_pt_byte + (coding->produced - bytes));
  8214       else
  8215         TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (saved_pt + (coding->produced - bytes),
  8216                           saved_pt_byte + (coding->produced - bytes));
  8217 
  8218       if (need_marker_adjustment)
  8219         {
  8220           struct Lisp_Marker *tail;
  8221 
  8222           for (tail = BUF_MARKERS (current_buffer); tail; tail = tail->next)
  8223             if (tail->need_adjustment)
  8224               {
  8225                 tail->need_adjustment = 0;
  8226                 if (tail->insertion_type)
  8227                   {
  8228                     tail->bytepos = from_byte;
  8229                     tail->charpos = from;
  8230                   }
  8231                 else
  8232                   {
  8233                     tail->bytepos = from_byte + coding->produced;
  8234                     tail->charpos
  8235                       = (NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters))
  8236                          ? tail->bytepos : from + coding->produced_char);
  8237                   }
  8238               }
  8239         }
  8240     }
  8241 
  8242   Vdeactivate_mark = old_deactivate_mark;
  8243   unbind_to (count, coding->dst_object);
  8244 }
  8245 
  8246 
  8247 /* Encode the text in the range FROM/FROM_BYTE and TO/TO_BYTE in
  8248    SRC_OBJECT into DST_OBJECT by coding context CODING.
  8249 
  8250    SRC_OBJECT is a buffer, a string, or Qnil.
  8251 
  8252    If it is a buffer, the text is at point of the buffer.  FROM and TO
  8253    are positions in the buffer.
  8254 
  8255    If it is a string, the text is at the beginning of the string.
  8256    FROM and TO are indices into the string.
  8257 
  8258    If it is nil, the text is at coding->source.  FROM and TO are
  8259    indices into coding->source.
  8260 
  8261    DST_OBJECT is a buffer, Qt, or Qnil.
  8262 
  8263    If it is a buffer, the encoded text is inserted at point of the
  8264    buffer.  If the buffer is the same as SRC_OBJECT, the source text
  8265    is replaced with the encoded text.
  8266 
  8267    If it is Qt, a string is made from the encoded text, and set in
  8268    CODING->dst_object.  However, if CODING->raw_destination is non-zero,
  8269    the encoded text is instead returned in CODING->destination as a C string,
  8270    and the caller is responsible for freeing CODING->destination.  This
  8271    feature is meant to be used when the caller doesn't need the result as
  8272    a Lisp string, and wants to avoid unnecessary consing of large strings.
  8273 
  8274    If it is Qnil, the encoded text is stored at CODING->destination.
  8275    The caller must allocate CODING->dst_bytes bytes at
  8276    CODING->destination by xmalloc.  If the encoded text is longer than
  8277    CODING->dst_bytes, CODING->destination is reallocated by xrealloc
  8278    (and CODING->dst_bytes is enlarged accordingly).  */
  8279 
  8280 void
  8281 encode_coding_object (struct coding_system *coding,
  8282                       Lisp_Object src_object,
  8283                       ptrdiff_t from, ptrdiff_t from_byte,
  8284                       ptrdiff_t to, ptrdiff_t to_byte,
  8285                       Lisp_Object dst_object)
  8286 {
  8287   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  8288   ptrdiff_t chars = to - from;
  8289   ptrdiff_t bytes = to_byte - from_byte;
  8290   Lisp_Object attrs;
  8291   ptrdiff_t saved_pt = -1, saved_pt_byte UNINIT;
  8292   bool need_marker_adjustment = 0;
  8293   bool kill_src_buffer = 0;
  8294   Lisp_Object old_deactivate_mark;
  8295 
  8296   old_deactivate_mark = Vdeactivate_mark;
  8297 
  8298   coding->src_object = src_object;
  8299   coding->src_chars = chars;
  8300   coding->src_bytes = bytes;
  8301   coding->src_multibyte = chars < bytes;
  8302 
  8303   attrs = CODING_ID_ATTRS (coding->id);
  8304 
  8305   bool same_buffer = false;
  8306   if (BASE_EQ (src_object, dst_object) && BUFFERP (src_object))
  8307     {
  8308       struct Lisp_Marker *tail;
  8309 
  8310       same_buffer = true;
  8311 
  8312       for (tail = BUF_MARKERS (XBUFFER (src_object)); tail; tail = tail->next)
  8313         {
  8314           tail->need_adjustment
  8315             = tail->charpos == (tail->insertion_type ? from : to);
  8316           need_marker_adjustment |= tail->need_adjustment;
  8317         }
  8318     }
  8319 
  8320   if (! NILP (CODING_ATTR_PRE_WRITE (attrs)))
  8321     {
  8322       coding->src_object = code_conversion_save (1, coding->src_multibyte);
  8323       set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (coding->src_object));
  8324       if (STRINGP (src_object))
  8325         insert_from_string (src_object, from, from_byte, chars, bytes, 0);
  8326       else if (BUFFERP (src_object))
  8327         insert_from_buffer (XBUFFER (src_object), from, chars, 0);
  8328       else
  8329         insert_1_both ((char *) coding->source + from, chars, bytes, 0, 0, 0);
  8330 
  8331       if (same_buffer)
  8332         {
  8333           set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (src_object));
  8334           saved_pt = PT, saved_pt_byte = PT_BYTE;
  8335           del_range_both (from, from_byte, to, to_byte, 1);
  8336           set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (coding->src_object));
  8337         }
  8338 
  8339       safe_call2 (CODING_ATTR_PRE_WRITE (attrs),
  8340                   make_fixnum (BEG), make_fixnum (Z));
  8341       if (XBUFFER (coding->src_object) != current_buffer)
  8342         kill_src_buffer = 1;
  8343       coding->src_object = Fcurrent_buffer ();
  8344       if (BEG != GPT)
  8345         move_gap_both (BEG, BEG_BYTE);
  8346       coding->src_chars = Z - BEG;
  8347       coding->src_bytes = Z_BYTE - BEG_BYTE;
  8348       coding->src_pos = BEG;
  8349       coding->src_pos_byte = BEG_BYTE;
  8350       coding->src_multibyte = Z < Z_BYTE;
  8351     }
  8352   else if (STRINGP (src_object))
  8353     {
  8354       code_conversion_save (0, 0);
  8355       coding->src_pos = from;
  8356       coding->src_pos_byte = from_byte;
  8357     }
  8358   else if (BUFFERP (src_object))
  8359     {
  8360       code_conversion_save (0, 0);
  8361       set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (src_object));
  8362       if (same_buffer)
  8363         {
  8364           saved_pt = PT, saved_pt_byte = PT_BYTE;
  8365           coding->src_object = del_range_1 (from, to, 1, 1);
  8366           coding->src_pos = 0;
  8367           coding->src_pos_byte = 0;
  8368         }
  8369       else
  8370         {
  8371           if (from < GPT && to >= GPT)
  8372             move_gap_both (from, from_byte);
  8373           coding->src_pos = from;
  8374           coding->src_pos_byte = from_byte;
  8375         }
  8376     }
  8377   else
  8378     {
  8379       code_conversion_save (0, 0);
  8380       coding->src_pos = from;
  8381       coding->src_pos_byte = from_byte;
  8382     }
  8383 
  8384   if (BUFFERP (dst_object))
  8385     {
  8386       coding->dst_object = dst_object;
  8387       if (BASE_EQ (src_object, dst_object))
  8388         {
  8389           coding->dst_pos = from;
  8390           coding->dst_pos_byte = from_byte;
  8391         }
  8392       else
  8393         {
  8394           struct buffer *current = current_buffer;
  8395 
  8396           set_buffer_temp (XBUFFER (dst_object));
  8397           coding->dst_pos = PT;
  8398           coding->dst_pos_byte = PT_BYTE;
  8399           move_gap_both (coding->dst_pos, coding->dst_pos_byte);
  8400           set_buffer_temp (current);
  8401         }
  8402       coding->dst_multibyte
  8403         = ! NILP (BVAR (XBUFFER (dst_object), enable_multibyte_characters));
  8404     }
  8405   else if (EQ (dst_object, Qt))
  8406     {
  8407       ptrdiff_t dst_bytes = max (1, coding->src_chars);
  8408       coding->dst_object = Qnil;
  8409       coding->destination = xmalloc (dst_bytes);
  8410       coding->dst_bytes = dst_bytes;
  8411       coding->dst_multibyte = 0;
  8412     }
  8413   else
  8414     {
  8415       coding->dst_object = Qnil;
  8416       coding->dst_multibyte = 0;
  8417     }
  8418 
  8419   encode_coding (coding);
  8420 
  8421   if (EQ (dst_object, Qt))
  8422     {
  8423       if (BUFFERP (coding->dst_object))
  8424         coding->dst_object = Fbuffer_string ();
  8425       else if (coding->raw_destination)
  8426         /* This is used to avoid creating huge Lisp string.
  8427            NOTE: caller who sets `raw_destination' is also
  8428            responsible for freeing `destination' buffer.  */
  8429         coding->dst_object = Qnil;
  8430       else
  8431         {
  8432           coding->dst_object
  8433             = make_unibyte_string ((char *) coding->destination,
  8434                                    coding->produced);
  8435           xfree (coding->destination);
  8436         }
  8437     }
  8438 
  8439   if (saved_pt >= 0)
  8440     {
  8441       /* This is the case of:
  8442          (BUFFERP (src_object) && BASE_EQ (src_object, dst_object))
  8443          As we have moved PT while replacing the original buffer
  8444          contents, we must recover it now.  */
  8445       set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (src_object));
  8446       if (saved_pt < from)
  8447         TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (saved_pt, saved_pt_byte);
  8448       else if (saved_pt < from + chars)
  8449         TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (from, from_byte);
  8450       else if (! NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters)))
  8451         TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (saved_pt + (coding->produced_char - chars),
  8452                           saved_pt_byte + (coding->produced - bytes));
  8453       else
  8454         TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (saved_pt + (coding->produced - bytes),
  8455                           saved_pt_byte + (coding->produced - bytes));
  8456 
  8457       if (need_marker_adjustment)
  8458         {
  8459           struct Lisp_Marker *tail;
  8460 
  8461           for (tail = BUF_MARKERS (current_buffer); tail; tail = tail->next)
  8462             if (tail->need_adjustment)
  8463               {
  8464                 tail->need_adjustment = 0;
  8465                 if (tail->insertion_type)
  8466                   {
  8467                     tail->bytepos = from_byte;
  8468                     tail->charpos = from;
  8469                   }
  8470                 else
  8471                   {
  8472                     tail->bytepos = from_byte + coding->produced;
  8473                     tail->charpos
  8474                       = (NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters))
  8475                          ? tail->bytepos : from + coding->produced_char);
  8476                   }
  8477               }
  8478         }
  8479     }
  8480 
  8481   if (kill_src_buffer)
  8482     Fkill_buffer (coding->src_object);
  8483 
  8484   Vdeactivate_mark = old_deactivate_mark;
  8485   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  8486 }
  8487 
  8488 
  8489 Lisp_Object
  8490 preferred_coding_system (void)
  8491 {
  8492   int id = coding_categories[coding_priorities[0]].id;
  8493 
  8494   return CODING_ID_NAME (id);
  8495 }
  8496 
  8497 #if defined (WINDOWSNT) || defined (CYGWIN)
  8498 
  8499 Lisp_Object
  8500 from_unicode (Lisp_Object str)
  8501 {
  8502   CHECK_STRING (str);
  8503   if (!STRING_MULTIBYTE (str) &&
  8504       SBYTES (str) & 1)
  8505     {
  8506       str = Fsubstring (str, make_fixnum (0), make_fixnum (-1));
  8507     }
  8508 
  8509   return code_convert_string_norecord (str, Qutf_16le, 0);
  8510 }
  8511 
  8512 Lisp_Object
  8513 from_unicode_buffer (const wchar_t *wstr)
  8514 {
  8515   /* We get one of the two final null bytes for free.  */
  8516   ptrdiff_t len = 1 + sizeof (wchar_t) * wcslen (wstr);
  8517   AUTO_STRING_WITH_LEN (str, (char *) wstr, len);
  8518   return from_unicode (str);
  8519 }
  8520 
  8521 wchar_t *
  8522 to_unicode (Lisp_Object str, Lisp_Object *buf)
  8523 {
  8524   *buf = code_convert_string_norecord (str, Qutf_16le, 1);
  8525   /* We need to make another copy (in addition to the one made by
  8526      code_convert_string_norecord) to ensure that the final string is
  8527      _doubly_ zero terminated --- that is, that the string is
  8528      terminated by two zero bytes and one utf-16le null character.
  8529      Because strings are already terminated with a single zero byte,
  8530      we just add one additional zero. */
  8531   str = make_uninit_string (SBYTES (*buf) + 1);
  8532   memcpy (SDATA (str), SDATA (*buf), SBYTES (*buf));
  8533   SDATA (str) [SBYTES (*buf)] = '\0';
  8534   *buf = str;
  8535   return WCSDATA (*buf);
  8536 }
  8537 
  8538 #endif /* WINDOWSNT || CYGWIN */
  8539 
  8540 
  8541 /*** 8. Emacs Lisp library functions ***/
  8542 
  8543 DEFUN ("coding-system-p", Fcoding_system_p, Scoding_system_p, 1, 1, 0,
  8544        doc: /* Return t if OBJECT is nil or a coding-system.
  8545 See the documentation of `define-coding-system' for information
  8546 about coding-system objects.  */)
  8547   (Lisp_Object object)
  8548 {
  8549   if (NILP (object)
  8550       || CODING_SYSTEM_ID (object) >= 0)
  8551     return Qt;
  8552   if (! SYMBOLP (object)
  8553       || NILP (Fget (object, Qcoding_system_define_form)))
  8554     return Qnil;
  8555   return Qt;
  8556 }
  8557 
  8558 DEFUN ("read-non-nil-coding-system", Fread_non_nil_coding_system,
  8559        Sread_non_nil_coding_system, 1, 1, 0,
  8560        doc: /* Read a coding system from the minibuffer, prompting with string PROMPT.  */)
  8561   (Lisp_Object prompt)
  8562 {
  8563   Lisp_Object val;
  8564   do
  8565     {
  8566       val = Fcompleting_read (prompt, Vcoding_system_alist, Qnil,
  8567                               Qt, Qnil, Qcoding_system_history, Qnil, Qnil);
  8568     }
  8569   while (SCHARS (val) == 0);
  8570   return (Fintern (val, Qnil));
  8571 }
  8572 
  8573 DEFUN ("read-coding-system", Fread_coding_system, Sread_coding_system, 1, 2, 0,
  8574        doc: /* Read a coding system from the minibuffer, prompting with string PROMPT.
  8575 If the user enters null input, return second argument DEFAULT-CODING-SYSTEM.
  8576 Ignores case when completing coding systems (all Emacs coding systems
  8577 are lower-case).  */)
  8578   (Lisp_Object prompt, Lisp_Object default_coding_system)
  8579 {
  8580   Lisp_Object val;
  8581   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  8582 
  8583   if (SYMBOLP (default_coding_system))
  8584     default_coding_system = SYMBOL_NAME (default_coding_system);
  8585   specbind (Qcompletion_ignore_case, Qt);
  8586   val = Fcompleting_read (prompt, Vcoding_system_alist, Qnil,
  8587                           Qt, Qnil, Qcoding_system_history,
  8588                           default_coding_system, Qnil);
  8589   val = unbind_to (count, val);
  8590   return (SCHARS (val) == 0 ? Qnil : Fintern (val, Qnil));
  8591 }
  8592 
  8593 DEFUN ("check-coding-system", Fcheck_coding_system, Scheck_coding_system,
  8594        1, 1, 0,
  8595        doc: /* Check validity of CODING-SYSTEM.
  8596 If valid, return CODING-SYSTEM, else signal a `coding-system-error' error.
  8597 It is valid if it is nil or a symbol defined as a coding system by the
  8598 function `define-coding-system'.  */)
  8599   (Lisp_Object coding_system)
  8600 {
  8601   Lisp_Object define_form;
  8602 
  8603   define_form = Fget (coding_system, Qcoding_system_define_form);
  8604   if (! NILP (define_form))
  8605     {
  8606       Fput (coding_system, Qcoding_system_define_form, Qnil);
  8607       safe_eval (define_form);
  8608     }
  8609   if (!NILP (Fcoding_system_p (coding_system)))
  8610     return coding_system;
  8611   xsignal1 (Qcoding_system_error, coding_system);
  8612 }
  8613 
  8614 
  8615 /* Detect how the bytes at SRC of length SRC_BYTES are encoded.  If
  8616    HIGHEST, return the coding system of the highest
  8617    priority among the detected coding systems.  Otherwise return a
  8618    list of detected coding systems sorted by their priorities.  If
  8619    MULTIBYTEP, it is assumed that the bytes are in correct
  8620    multibyte form but contains only ASCII and eight-bit chars.
  8621    Otherwise, the bytes are raw bytes.
  8622 
  8623    CODING-SYSTEM controls the detection as below:
  8624 
  8625    If it is nil, detect both text-format and eol-format.  If the
  8626    text-format part of CODING-SYSTEM is already specified
  8627    (e.g. `iso-latin-1'), detect only eol-format.  If the eol-format
  8628    part of CODING-SYSTEM is already specified (e.g. `undecided-unix'),
  8629    detect only text-format.  */
  8630 
  8631 Lisp_Object
  8632 detect_coding_system (const unsigned char *src,
  8633                       ptrdiff_t src_chars, ptrdiff_t src_bytes,
  8634                       bool highest, bool multibytep,
  8635                       Lisp_Object coding_system)
  8636 {
  8637   const unsigned char *src_end = src + src_bytes;
  8638   Lisp_Object attrs, eol_type;
  8639   Lisp_Object val = Qnil;
  8640   struct coding_system coding;
  8641   ptrdiff_t id;
  8642   struct coding_detection_info detect_info = {0};
  8643   enum coding_category base_category;
  8644   bool null_byte_found = 0, eight_bit_found = 0;
  8645 
  8646   if (NILP (coding_system))
  8647     coding_system = Qundecided;
  8648   setup_coding_system (coding_system, &coding);
  8649   attrs = CODING_ID_ATTRS (coding.id);
  8650   eol_type = CODING_ID_EOL_TYPE (coding.id);
  8651   coding_system = CODING_ATTR_BASE_NAME (attrs);
  8652 
  8653   coding.source = src;
  8654   coding.src_chars = src_chars;
  8655   coding.src_bytes = src_bytes;
  8656   coding.src_multibyte = multibytep;
  8657   coding.consumed = 0;
  8658   coding.mode |= CODING_MODE_LAST_BLOCK;
  8659   coding.head_ascii = 0;
  8660 
  8661   /* At first, detect text-format if necessary.  */
  8662   base_category = XFIXNUM (CODING_ATTR_CATEGORY (attrs));
  8663   if (base_category == coding_category_undecided)
  8664     {
  8665       enum coding_category category UNINIT;
  8666       struct coding_system *this UNINIT;
  8667       int c, i;
  8668       bool inhibit_nbd = inhibit_flag (coding.spec.undecided.inhibit_nbd,
  8669                                        inhibit_null_byte_detection);
  8670       bool inhibit_ied = inhibit_flag (coding.spec.undecided.inhibit_ied,
  8671                                        inhibit_iso_escape_detection);
  8672       bool prefer_utf_8 = coding.spec.undecided.prefer_utf_8;
  8673 
  8674       /* Skip all ASCII bytes except for a few ISO2022 controls.  */
  8675       for (; src < src_end; src++)
  8676         {
  8677           c = *src;
  8678           if (c & 0x80)
  8679             {
  8680               eight_bit_found = 1;
  8681               if (null_byte_found)
  8682                 break;
  8683             }
  8684           else if (c < 0x20)
  8685             {
  8686               if ((c == ISO_CODE_ESC || c == ISO_CODE_SI || c == ISO_CODE_SO)
  8687                   && ! inhibit_ied
  8688                   && ! detect_info.checked)
  8689                 {
  8690                   if (detect_coding_iso_2022 (&coding, &detect_info))
  8691                     {
  8692                       /* We have scanned the whole data.  */
  8693                       if (! (detect_info.rejected & CATEGORY_MASK_ISO_7_ELSE))
  8694                         {
  8695                           /* We didn't find an 8-bit code.  We may
  8696                              have found a null-byte, but it's very
  8697                              rare that a binary file confirm to
  8698                              ISO-2022.  */
  8699                           src = src_end;
  8700                           coding.head_ascii = src - coding.source;
  8701                         }
  8702                       detect_info.rejected |= ~CATEGORY_MASK_ISO_ESCAPE;
  8703                       break;
  8704                     }
  8705                 }
  8706               else if (! c && !inhibit_nbd)
  8707                 {
  8708                   null_byte_found = 1;
  8709                   if (eight_bit_found)
  8710                     break;
  8711                 }
  8712               if (! eight_bit_found)
  8713                 coding.head_ascii++;
  8714             }
  8715           else if (! eight_bit_found)
  8716             coding.head_ascii++;
  8717         }
  8718 
  8719       if (null_byte_found || eight_bit_found
  8720           || coding.head_ascii < coding.src_bytes
  8721           || detect_info.found)
  8722         {
  8723           if (coding.head_ascii == coding.src_bytes)
  8724             /* As all bytes are 7-bit, we can ignore non-ISO-2022 codings.  */
  8725             for (i = 0; i < coding_category_raw_text; i++)
  8726               {
  8727                 category = coding_priorities[i];
  8728                 this = coding_categories + category;
  8729                 if (detect_info.found & (1 << category))
  8730                   break;
  8731               }
  8732           else
  8733             {
  8734               if (null_byte_found)
  8735                 {
  8736                   detect_info.checked |= ~CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16;
  8737                   detect_info.rejected |= ~CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16;
  8738                 }
  8739               else if (prefer_utf_8
  8740                        && detect_coding_utf_8 (&coding, &detect_info))
  8741                 {
  8742                   detect_info.checked |= ~CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_8;
  8743                   detect_info.rejected |= ~CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_8;
  8744                 }
  8745               for (i = 0; i < coding_category_raw_text; i++)
  8746                 {
  8747                   category = coding_priorities[i];
  8748                   this = coding_categories + category;
  8749 
  8750                   if (this->id < 0)
  8751                     {
  8752                       /* No coding system of this category is defined.  */
  8753                       detect_info.rejected |= (1 << category);
  8754                     }
  8755                   else if (category >= coding_category_raw_text)
  8756                     continue;
  8757                   else if (detect_info.checked & (1 << category))
  8758                     {
  8759                       if (highest
  8760                           && (detect_info.found & (1 << category)))
  8761                         break;
  8762                     }
  8763                   else if ((*(this->detector)) (&coding, &detect_info)
  8764                            && highest
  8765                            && (detect_info.found & (1 << category)))
  8766                     {
  8767                       if (category == coding_category_utf_16_auto)
  8768                         {
  8769                           if (detect_info.found & CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16_LE)
  8770                             category = coding_category_utf_16_le;
  8771                           else
  8772                             category = coding_category_utf_16_be;
  8773                         }
  8774                       break;
  8775                     }
  8776                 }
  8777             }
  8778         }
  8779 
  8780       if ((detect_info.rejected & CATEGORY_MASK_ANY) == CATEGORY_MASK_ANY
  8781           || null_byte_found)
  8782         {
  8783           detect_info.found = CATEGORY_MASK_RAW_TEXT;
  8784           id = CODING_SYSTEM_ID (Qno_conversion);
  8785           val = list1i (id);
  8786         }
  8787       else if (! detect_info.rejected && ! detect_info.found)
  8788         {
  8789           detect_info.found = CATEGORY_MASK_ANY;
  8790           id = coding_categories[coding_category_undecided].id;
  8791           val = list1i (id);
  8792         }
  8793       else if (highest)
  8794         {
  8795           if (detect_info.found)
  8796             {
  8797               detect_info.found = 1 << category;
  8798               val = list1i (this->id);
  8799             }
  8800           else
  8801             for (i = 0; i < coding_category_raw_text; i++)
  8802               if (! (detect_info.rejected & (1 << coding_priorities[i])))
  8803                 {
  8804                   detect_info.found = 1 << coding_priorities[i];
  8805                   id = coding_categories[coding_priorities[i]].id;
  8806                   val = list1i (id);
  8807                   break;
  8808                 }
  8809         }
  8810       else
  8811         {
  8812           int mask = detect_info.rejected | detect_info.found;
  8813           int found = 0;
  8814 
  8815           for (i = coding_category_raw_text - 1; i >= 0; i--)
  8816             {
  8817               category = coding_priorities[i];
  8818               if (! (mask & (1 << category)))
  8819                 {
  8820                   found |= 1 << category;
  8821                   id = coding_categories[category].id;
  8822                   if (id >= 0)
  8823                     val = list1i (id);
  8824                 }
  8825             }
  8826           for (i = coding_category_raw_text - 1; i >= 0; i--)
  8827             {
  8828               category = coding_priorities[i];
  8829               if (detect_info.found & (1 << category))
  8830                 {
  8831                   id = coding_categories[category].id;
  8832                   val = Fcons (make_fixnum (id), val);
  8833                 }
  8834             }
  8835           detect_info.found |= found;
  8836         }
  8837     }
  8838   else if (base_category == coding_category_utf_8_auto)
  8839     {
  8840       if (detect_coding_utf_8 (&coding, &detect_info))
  8841         {
  8842           struct coding_system *this;
  8843 
  8844           if (detect_info.found & CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_8_SIG)
  8845             this = coding_categories + coding_category_utf_8_sig;
  8846           else
  8847             this = coding_categories + coding_category_utf_8_nosig;
  8848           val = list1i (this->id);
  8849         }
  8850     }
  8851   else if (base_category == coding_category_utf_16_auto)
  8852     {
  8853       if (detect_coding_utf_16 (&coding, &detect_info))
  8854         {
  8855           struct coding_system *this;
  8856 
  8857           if (detect_info.found & CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16_LE)
  8858             this = coding_categories + coding_category_utf_16_le;
  8859           else if (detect_info.found & CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16_BE)
  8860             this = coding_categories + coding_category_utf_16_be;
  8861           else if (detect_info.rejected & CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16_LE_NOSIG)
  8862             this = coding_categories + coding_category_utf_16_be_nosig;
  8863           else
  8864             this = coding_categories + coding_category_utf_16_le_nosig;
  8865           val = list1i (this->id);
  8866         }
  8867     }
  8868   else
  8869     {
  8870       detect_info.found = 1 << XFIXNUM (CODING_ATTR_CATEGORY (attrs));
  8871       val = list1i (coding.id);
  8872     }
  8873 
  8874   /* Then, detect eol-format if necessary.  */
  8875   {
  8876     int normal_eol = -1, utf_16_be_eol = -1, utf_16_le_eol = -1;
  8877     Lisp_Object tail;
  8878 
  8879     if (VECTORP (eol_type))
  8880       {
  8881         if (detect_info.found & ~CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16)
  8882           {
  8883             if (null_byte_found)
  8884               normal_eol = EOL_SEEN_LF;
  8885             else
  8886               normal_eol = detect_eol (coding.source, src_bytes,
  8887                                        coding_category_raw_text);
  8888           }
  8889         if (detect_info.found & (CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16_BE
  8890                                  | CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16_BE_NOSIG))
  8891           utf_16_be_eol = detect_eol (coding.source, src_bytes,
  8892                                       coding_category_utf_16_be);
  8893         if (detect_info.found & (CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16_LE
  8894                                  | CATEGORY_MASK_UTF_16_LE_NOSIG))
  8895           utf_16_le_eol = detect_eol (coding.source, src_bytes,
  8896                                       coding_category_utf_16_le);
  8897       }
  8898     else
  8899       {
  8900         if (EQ (eol_type, Qunix))
  8901           normal_eol = utf_16_be_eol = utf_16_le_eol = EOL_SEEN_LF;
  8902         else if (EQ (eol_type, Qdos))
  8903           normal_eol = utf_16_be_eol = utf_16_le_eol = EOL_SEEN_CRLF;
  8904         else
  8905           normal_eol = utf_16_be_eol = utf_16_le_eol = EOL_SEEN_CR;
  8906       }
  8907 
  8908     for (tail = val; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  8909       {
  8910         enum coding_category category;
  8911         int this_eol;
  8912 
  8913         id = XFIXNUM (XCAR (tail));
  8914         attrs = CODING_ID_ATTRS (id);
  8915         category = XFIXNUM (CODING_ATTR_CATEGORY (attrs));
  8916         eol_type = CODING_ID_EOL_TYPE (id);
  8917         if (VECTORP (eol_type))
  8918           {
  8919             if (category == coding_category_utf_16_be
  8920                 || category == coding_category_utf_16_be_nosig)
  8921               this_eol = utf_16_be_eol;
  8922             else if (category == coding_category_utf_16_le
  8923                      || category == coding_category_utf_16_le_nosig)
  8924               this_eol = utf_16_le_eol;
  8925             else
  8926               this_eol = normal_eol;
  8927 
  8928             if (this_eol == EOL_SEEN_LF)
  8929               XSETCAR (tail, AREF (eol_type, 0));
  8930             else if (this_eol == EOL_SEEN_CRLF)
  8931               XSETCAR (tail, AREF (eol_type, 1));
  8932             else if (this_eol == EOL_SEEN_CR)
  8933               XSETCAR (tail, AREF (eol_type, 2));
  8934             else
  8935               XSETCAR (tail, CODING_ID_NAME (id));
  8936           }
  8937         else
  8938           XSETCAR (tail, CODING_ID_NAME (id));
  8939       }
  8940   }
  8941 
  8942   return (highest ? (CONSP (val) ? XCAR (val) : Qnil) : val);
  8943 }
  8944 
  8945 
  8946 DEFUN ("detect-coding-region", Fdetect_coding_region, Sdetect_coding_region,
  8947        2, 3, 0,
  8948        doc: /* Detect coding system of the text in the region between START and END.
  8949 Return a list of possible coding systems ordered by priority.
  8950 The coding systems to try and their priorities follows what
  8951 the function `coding-system-priority-list' (which see) returns.
  8952 
  8953 If only ASCII characters are found (except for such ISO-2022 control
  8954 characters as ESC), it returns a list of single element `undecided'
  8955 or its subsidiary coding system according to a detected end-of-line
  8956 format.
  8957 
  8958 If optional argument HIGHEST is non-nil, return the coding system of
  8959 highest priority.  */)
  8960   (Lisp_Object start, Lisp_Object end, Lisp_Object highest)
  8961 {
  8962   ptrdiff_t from, to;
  8963   ptrdiff_t from_byte, to_byte;
  8964 
  8965   validate_region (&start, &end);
  8966   from = XFIXNUM (start), to = XFIXNUM (end);
  8967   from_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (from);
  8968   to_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (to);
  8969 
  8970   if (from < GPT && to >= GPT)
  8971     move_gap_both (to, to_byte);
  8972 
  8973   return detect_coding_system (BYTE_POS_ADDR (from_byte),
  8974                                to - from, to_byte - from_byte,
  8975                                !NILP (highest),
  8976                                !NILP (BVAR (current_buffer
  8977                                       , enable_multibyte_characters)),
  8978                                Qnil);
  8979 }
  8980 
  8981 DEFUN ("detect-coding-string", Fdetect_coding_string, Sdetect_coding_string,
  8982        1, 2, 0,
  8983        doc: /* Detect coding system of the text in STRING.
  8984 Return a list of possible coding systems ordered by priority.
  8985 The coding systems to try and their priorities follows what
  8986 the function `coding-system-priority-list' (which see) returns.
  8987 
  8988 If only ASCII characters are found (except for such ISO-2022 control
  8989 characters as ESC), it returns a list of single element `undecided'
  8990 or its subsidiary coding system according to a detected end-of-line
  8991 format.
  8992 
  8993 If optional argument HIGHEST is non-nil, return the coding system of
  8994 highest priority.  */)
  8995   (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object highest)
  8996 {
  8997   CHECK_STRING (string);
  8998 
  8999   return detect_coding_system (SDATA (string),
  9000                                SCHARS (string), SBYTES (string),
  9001                                !NILP (highest), STRING_MULTIBYTE (string),
  9002                                Qnil);
  9003 }
  9004 
  9005 
  9006 static bool
  9007 char_encodable_p (int c, Lisp_Object attrs)
  9008 {
  9009   Lisp_Object tail;
  9010   struct charset *charset;
  9011   Lisp_Object translation_table;
  9012 
  9013   translation_table = CODING_ATTR_TRANS_TBL (attrs);
  9014   if (! NILP (translation_table))
  9015     c = translate_char (translation_table, c);
  9016   for (tail = CODING_ATTR_CHARSET_LIST (attrs);
  9017        CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  9018     {
  9019       charset = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (tail)));
  9020       if (CHAR_CHARSET_P (c, charset))
  9021         break;
  9022     }
  9023   return (! NILP (tail));
  9024 }
  9025 
  9026 
  9027 /* Return a list of coding systems that safely encode the text between
  9028    START and END.  If EXCLUDE is non-nil, it is a list of coding
  9029    systems not to check.  The returned list doesn't contain any such
  9030    coding systems.  In any case, if the text contains only ASCII or is
  9031    unibyte, return t.  */
  9032 
  9033 DEFUN ("find-coding-systems-region-internal",
  9034        Ffind_coding_systems_region_internal,
  9035        Sfind_coding_systems_region_internal, 2, 3, 0,
  9036        doc: /* Internal use only.  */)
  9037   (Lisp_Object start, Lisp_Object end, Lisp_Object exclude)
  9038 {
  9039   Lisp_Object coding_attrs_list, safe_codings;
  9040   ptrdiff_t start_byte, end_byte;
  9041   const unsigned char *p, *pbeg, *pend;
  9042   int c;
  9043   Lisp_Object tail, elt, work_table;
  9044 
  9045   if (STRINGP (start))
  9046     {
  9047       if (!STRING_MULTIBYTE (start)
  9048           || SCHARS (start) == SBYTES (start))
  9049         return Qt;
  9050       start_byte = 0;
  9051       end_byte = SBYTES (start);
  9052     }
  9053   else
  9054     {
  9055       EMACS_INT s = fix_position (start);
  9056       EMACS_INT e = fix_position (end);
  9057       if (! (BEG <= s && s <= e && e <= Z))
  9058         args_out_of_range (start, end);
  9059       if (NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters)))
  9060         return Qt;
  9061       start_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (s);
  9062       end_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (e);
  9063       if (e - s == end_byte - start_byte)
  9064         return Qt;
  9065 
  9066       if (s < GPT && GPT < e)
  9067         {
  9068           if (GPT - s < e - GPT)
  9069             move_gap_both (s, start_byte);
  9070           else
  9071             move_gap_both (e, end_byte);
  9072         }
  9073     }
  9074 
  9075   coding_attrs_list = Qnil;
  9076   for (tail = Vcoding_system_list; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  9077     if (NILP (exclude)
  9078         || NILP (Fmemq (XCAR (tail), exclude)))
  9079       {
  9080         Lisp_Object attrs;
  9081 
  9082         attrs = AREF (CODING_SYSTEM_SPEC (XCAR (tail)), 0);
  9083         if (EQ (XCAR (tail), CODING_ATTR_BASE_NAME (attrs)))
  9084           {
  9085             ASET (attrs, coding_attr_trans_tbl,
  9086                   get_translation_table (attrs, 1, NULL));
  9087             coding_attrs_list = Fcons (attrs, coding_attrs_list);
  9088           }
  9089       }
  9090 
  9091   if (STRINGP (start))
  9092     p = pbeg = SDATA (start);
  9093   else
  9094     p = pbeg = BYTE_POS_ADDR (start_byte);
  9095   pend = p + (end_byte - start_byte);
  9096 
  9097   while (p < pend && ASCII_CHAR_P (*p)) p++;
  9098   while (p < pend && ASCII_CHAR_P (*(pend - 1))) pend--;
  9099 
  9100   work_table = Fmake_char_table (Qnil, Qnil);
  9101   while (p < pend)
  9102     {
  9103       if (ASCII_CHAR_P (*p))
  9104         p++;
  9105       else
  9106         {
  9107           c = string_char_advance (&p);
  9108           if (!NILP (char_table_ref (work_table, c)))
  9109             /* This character was already checked.  Ignore it.  */
  9110             continue;
  9111 
  9112           charset_map_loaded = 0;
  9113           for (tail = coding_attrs_list; CONSP (tail);)
  9114             {
  9115               elt = XCAR (tail);
  9116               if (NILP (elt))
  9117                 tail = XCDR (tail);
  9118               else if (char_encodable_p (c, elt))
  9119                 tail = XCDR (tail);
  9120               else if (CONSP (XCDR (tail)))
  9121                 {
  9122                   XSETCAR (tail, XCAR (XCDR (tail)));
  9123                   XSETCDR (tail, XCDR (XCDR (tail)));
  9124                 }
  9125               else
  9126                 {
  9127                   XSETCAR (tail, Qnil);
  9128                   tail = XCDR (tail);
  9129                 }
  9130             }
  9131           if (charset_map_loaded)
  9132             {
  9133               ptrdiff_t p_offset = p - pbeg, pend_offset = pend - pbeg;
  9134 
  9135               if (STRINGP (start))
  9136                 pbeg = SDATA (start);
  9137               else
  9138                 pbeg = BYTE_POS_ADDR (start_byte);
  9139               p = pbeg + p_offset;
  9140               pend = pbeg + pend_offset;
  9141             }
  9142           char_table_set (work_table, c, Qt);
  9143         }
  9144     }
  9145 
  9146   safe_codings = list2 (Qraw_text, Qno_conversion);
  9147   for (tail = coding_attrs_list; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  9148     if (! NILP (XCAR (tail)))
  9149       safe_codings = Fcons (CODING_ATTR_BASE_NAME (XCAR (tail)), safe_codings);
  9150 
  9151   return safe_codings;
  9152 }
  9153 
  9154 
  9155 DEFUN ("unencodable-char-position", Funencodable_char_position,
  9156        Sunencodable_char_position, 3, 5, 0,
  9157        doc: /* Return position of first un-encodable character in a region.
  9158 START and END specify the region and CODING-SYSTEM specifies the
  9159 encoding to check.  Return nil if CODING-SYSTEM does encode the region.
  9160 
  9161 If optional 4th argument COUNT is non-nil, it specifies at most how
  9162 many un-encodable characters to search.  In this case, the value is a
  9163 list of positions.
  9164 
  9165 If optional 5th argument STRING is non-nil, it is a string to search
  9166 for un-encodable characters.  In that case, START and END are indexes
  9167 to the string and treated as in `substring'.  */)
  9168   (Lisp_Object start, Lisp_Object end, Lisp_Object coding_system,
  9169    Lisp_Object count, Lisp_Object string)
  9170 {
  9171   EMACS_INT n;
  9172   struct coding_system coding;
  9173   Lisp_Object attrs, charset_list, translation_table;
  9174   Lisp_Object positions;
  9175   ptrdiff_t from, to;
  9176   const unsigned char *p, *stop, *pend;
  9177   bool ascii_compatible;
  9178 
  9179   setup_coding_system (Fcheck_coding_system (coding_system), &coding);
  9180   attrs = CODING_ID_ATTRS (coding.id);
  9181   if (EQ (CODING_ATTR_TYPE (attrs), Qraw_text))
  9182     return Qnil;
  9183   ascii_compatible = ! NILP (CODING_ATTR_ASCII_COMPAT (attrs));
  9184   charset_list = CODING_ATTR_CHARSET_LIST (attrs);
  9185   translation_table = get_translation_table (attrs, 1, NULL);
  9186 
  9187   if (NILP (string))
  9188     {
  9189       validate_region (&start, &end);
  9190       from = XFIXNUM (start);
  9191       to = XFIXNUM (end);
  9192       if (NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters))
  9193           || (ascii_compatible
  9194               && (to - from) == (CHAR_TO_BYTE (to) - (CHAR_TO_BYTE (from)))))
  9195         return Qnil;
  9196       p = CHAR_POS_ADDR (from);
  9197       pend = CHAR_POS_ADDR (to);
  9198       if (from < GPT && to >= GPT)
  9199         stop = GPT_ADDR;
  9200       else
  9201         stop = pend;
  9202     }
  9203   else
  9204     {
  9205       CHECK_STRING (string);
  9206       validate_subarray (string, start, end, SCHARS (string), &from, &to);
  9207       if (! STRING_MULTIBYTE (string))
  9208         return Qnil;
  9209       p = SDATA (string) + string_char_to_byte (string, from);
  9210       stop = pend = SDATA (string) + string_char_to_byte (string, to);
  9211       if (ascii_compatible && (to - from) == (pend - p))
  9212         return Qnil;
  9213     }
  9214 
  9215   if (NILP (count))
  9216     n = 1;
  9217   else
  9218     {
  9219       CHECK_FIXNAT (count);
  9220       n = XFIXNUM (count);
  9221     }
  9222 
  9223   positions = Qnil;
  9224   charset_map_loaded = 0;
  9225   while (1)
  9226     {
  9227       int c;
  9228 
  9229       if (ascii_compatible)
  9230         while (p < stop && ASCII_CHAR_P (*p))
  9231           p++, from++;
  9232       if (p >= stop)
  9233         {
  9234           if (p >= pend)
  9235             break;
  9236           stop = pend;
  9237           p = GAP_END_ADDR;
  9238         }
  9239 
  9240       c = string_char_advance (&p);
  9241       if (! (ASCII_CHAR_P (c) && ascii_compatible)
  9242           && ! char_charset (translate_char (translation_table, c),
  9243                              charset_list, NULL))
  9244         {
  9245           positions = Fcons (make_fixnum (from), positions);
  9246           n--;
  9247           if (n == 0)
  9248             break;
  9249         }
  9250 
  9251       from++;
  9252       if (charset_map_loaded && NILP (string))
  9253         {
  9254           p = CHAR_POS_ADDR (from);
  9255           pend = CHAR_POS_ADDR (to);
  9256           if (from < GPT && to >= GPT)
  9257             stop = GPT_ADDR;
  9258           else
  9259             stop = pend;
  9260           charset_map_loaded = 0;
  9261         }
  9262     }
  9263 
  9264   return (NILP (count) ? Fcar (positions) : Fnreverse (positions));
  9265 }
  9266 
  9267 
  9268 DEFUN ("check-coding-systems-region", Fcheck_coding_systems_region,
  9269        Scheck_coding_systems_region, 3, 3, 0,
  9270        doc: /* Check if text between START and END is encodable by CODING-SYSTEM-LIST.
  9271 
  9272 START and END are buffer positions specifying the region.
  9273 CODING-SYSTEM-LIST is a list of coding systems to check.
  9274 
  9275 If all coding systems in CODING-SYSTEM-LIST can encode the region, the
  9276 function returns nil.
  9277 
  9278 If some of the coding systems cannot encode the whole region, value is
  9279 an alist, each element of which has the form (CODING-SYSTEM POS1 POS2 ...),
  9280 which means that CODING-SYSTEM cannot encode the text at buffer positions
  9281 POS1, POS2, ...
  9282 
  9283 START may be a string.  In that case, check if the string is
  9284 encodable, and the value contains character indices into the string
  9285 instead of buffer positions.  END is ignored in this case.
  9286 
  9287 If the current buffer (or START if it is a string) is unibyte, the value
  9288 is nil.  */)
  9289   (Lisp_Object start, Lisp_Object end, Lisp_Object coding_system_list)
  9290 {
  9291   Lisp_Object list;
  9292   ptrdiff_t start_byte, end_byte;
  9293   ptrdiff_t pos;
  9294   const unsigned char *p, *pbeg, *pend;
  9295   int c;
  9296   Lisp_Object tail, elt, attrs;
  9297 
  9298   if (STRINGP (start))
  9299     {
  9300       if (!STRING_MULTIBYTE (start)
  9301           || SCHARS (start) == SBYTES (start))
  9302         return Qnil;
  9303       start_byte = 0;
  9304       end_byte = SBYTES (start);
  9305       pos = 0;
  9306     }
  9307   else
  9308     {
  9309       EMACS_INT s = fix_position (start);
  9310       EMACS_INT e = fix_position (end);
  9311       if (! (BEG <= s && s <= e && e <= Z))
  9312         args_out_of_range (start, end);
  9313       if (NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters)))
  9314         return Qnil;
  9315       start_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (s);
  9316       end_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (e);
  9317       if (e - s == end_byte - start_byte)
  9318         return Qnil;
  9319 
  9320       if (s < GPT && GPT < e)
  9321         {
  9322           if (GPT - s < e - GPT)
  9323             move_gap_both (s, start_byte);
  9324           else
  9325             move_gap_both (e, end_byte);
  9326         }
  9327       pos = s;
  9328     }
  9329 
  9330   list = Qnil;
  9331   for (tail = coding_system_list; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  9332     {
  9333       elt = XCAR (tail);
  9334       Lisp_Object spec = CODING_SYSTEM_SPEC (elt);
  9335       if (!VECTORP (spec))
  9336         xsignal1 (Qcoding_system_error, elt);
  9337       attrs = AREF (spec, 0);
  9338       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_trans_tbl,
  9339             get_translation_table (attrs, 1, NULL));
  9340       list = Fcons (list2 (elt, attrs), list);
  9341     }
  9342 
  9343   if (STRINGP (start))
  9344     p = pbeg = SDATA (start);
  9345   else
  9346     p = pbeg = BYTE_POS_ADDR (start_byte);
  9347   pend = p + (end_byte - start_byte);
  9348 
  9349   while (p < pend && ASCII_CHAR_P (*p)) p++, pos++;
  9350   while (p < pend && ASCII_CHAR_P (*(pend - 1))) pend--;
  9351 
  9352   while (p < pend)
  9353     {
  9354       if (ASCII_CHAR_P (*p))
  9355         p++;
  9356       else
  9357         {
  9358           c = string_char_advance (&p);
  9359 
  9360           charset_map_loaded = 0;
  9361           for (tail = list; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  9362             {
  9363               elt = XCDR (XCAR (tail));
  9364               if (! char_encodable_p (c, XCAR (elt)))
  9365                 XSETCDR (elt, Fcons (make_fixnum (pos), XCDR (elt)));
  9366             }
  9367           if (charset_map_loaded)
  9368             {
  9369               ptrdiff_t p_offset = p - pbeg, pend_offset = pend - pbeg;
  9370 
  9371               if (STRINGP (start))
  9372                 pbeg = SDATA (start);
  9373               else
  9374                 pbeg = BYTE_POS_ADDR (start_byte);
  9375               p = pbeg + p_offset;
  9376               pend = pbeg + pend_offset;
  9377             }
  9378         }
  9379       pos++;
  9380     }
  9381 
  9382   tail = list;
  9383   list = Qnil;
  9384   for (; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  9385     {
  9386       elt = XCAR (tail);
  9387       if (CONSP (XCDR (XCDR (elt))))
  9388         list = Fcons (Fcons (XCAR (elt), Fnreverse (XCDR (XCDR (elt)))),
  9389                       list);
  9390     }
  9391 
  9392   return list;
  9393 }
  9394 
  9395 
  9396 static Lisp_Object
  9397 code_convert_region (Lisp_Object start, Lisp_Object end,
  9398                      Lisp_Object coding_system, Lisp_Object dst_object,
  9399                      bool encodep, bool norecord)
  9400 {
  9401   struct coding_system coding;
  9402   ptrdiff_t from, from_byte, to, to_byte;
  9403   Lisp_Object src_object;
  9404 
  9405   if (NILP (coding_system))
  9406     coding_system = Qno_conversion;
  9407   else
  9408     CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM (coding_system);
  9409   src_object = Fcurrent_buffer ();
  9410   if (NILP (dst_object))
  9411     dst_object = src_object;
  9412   else if (! EQ (dst_object, Qt))
  9413     CHECK_BUFFER (dst_object);
  9414 
  9415   validate_region (&start, &end);
  9416   from = XFIXNAT (start);
  9417   from_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (from);
  9418   to = XFIXNAT (end);
  9419   to_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (to);
  9420 
  9421   setup_coding_system (coding_system, &coding);
  9422   coding.mode |= CODING_MODE_LAST_BLOCK;
  9423 
  9424   if (BUFFERP (dst_object) && !BASE_EQ (dst_object, src_object))
  9425     {
  9426       struct buffer *buf = XBUFFER (dst_object);
  9427       ptrdiff_t buf_pt = BUF_PT (buf);
  9428 
  9429       invalidate_buffer_caches (buf, buf_pt, buf_pt);
  9430     }
  9431 
  9432   if (encodep)
  9433     encode_coding_object (&coding, src_object, from, from_byte, to, to_byte,
  9434                           dst_object);
  9435   else
  9436     decode_coding_object (&coding, src_object, from, from_byte, to, to_byte,
  9437                           dst_object);
  9438   if (! norecord)
  9439     Vlast_coding_system_used = CODING_ID_NAME (coding.id);
  9440 
  9441   return (BUFFERP (dst_object)
  9442           ? make_fixnum (coding.produced_char)
  9443           : coding.dst_object);
  9444 }
  9445 
  9446 
  9447 DEFUN ("decode-coding-region", Fdecode_coding_region, Sdecode_coding_region,
  9448        3, 4, "r\nzCoding system: ",
  9449        doc: /* Decode the current region using the specified coding system.
  9450 Interactively, prompt for the coding system to decode the region, and
  9451 replace the region with the decoded text.
  9452 
  9453 \"Decoding\" means transforming bytes into readable text (characters).
  9454 If, for instance, you have a region that contains data that represents
  9455 the two bytes #xc2 #xa9, after calling this function with the utf-8
  9456 coding system, the region will contain the single
  9457 character ?\\N{COPYRIGHT SIGN}.
  9458 
  9459 When called from a program, takes four arguments:
  9460         START, END, CODING-SYSTEM, and DESTINATION.
  9461 START and END are buffer positions.
  9462 
  9463 Optional 4th arguments DESTINATION specifies where the decoded text goes.
  9464 If nil, the region between START and END is replaced by the decoded text.
  9465 If buffer, the decoded text is inserted in that buffer after point (point
  9466 does not move).  If that buffer is unibyte, it receives the individual
  9467 bytes of the internal representation of the decoded text.
  9468 In those cases, the length of the decoded text is returned.
  9469 If DESTINATION is t, the decoded text is returned.
  9470 
  9471 This function sets `last-coding-system-used' to the precise coding system
  9472 used (which may be different from CODING-SYSTEM if CODING-SYSTEM is
  9473 not fully specified.)  */)
  9474   (Lisp_Object start, Lisp_Object end, Lisp_Object coding_system, Lisp_Object destination)
  9475 {
  9476   return code_convert_region (start, end, coding_system, destination, 0, 0);
  9477 }
  9478 
  9479 DEFUN ("encode-coding-region", Fencode_coding_region, Sencode_coding_region,
  9480        3, 4, "r\nzCoding system: ",
  9481        doc: /* Encode the current region using th specified coding system.
  9482 Interactively, prompt for the coding system to encode the region, and
  9483 replace the region with the bytes that are the result of the encoding.
  9484 
  9485 What's meant by \"encoding\" is transforming textual data (characters)
  9486 into bytes.  If, for instance, you have a region that contains the
  9487 single character ?\\N{COPYRIGHT SIGN}, after calling this function with
  9488 the utf-8 coding system, the data in the region will represent the two
  9489 bytes #xc2 #xa9.
  9490 
  9491 When called from a program, takes four arguments:
  9492         START, END, CODING-SYSTEM and DESTINATION.
  9493 START and END are buffer positions.
  9494 
  9495 Optional 4th argument DESTINATION specifies where the encoded text goes.
  9496 If nil, the region between START and END is replaced by the encoded text.
  9497 If buffer, the encoded text is inserted in that buffer after point (point
  9498 does not move).
  9499 In those cases, the length of the encoded text is returned.
  9500 If DESTINATION is t, the encoded text is returned.
  9501 
  9502 This function sets `last-coding-system-used' to the precise coding system
  9503 used (which may be different from CODING-SYSTEM if CODING-SYSTEM is
  9504 not fully specified.)  */)
  9505   (Lisp_Object start, Lisp_Object end, Lisp_Object coding_system, Lisp_Object destination)
  9506 {
  9507   return code_convert_region (start, end, coding_system, destination, 1, 0);
  9508 }
  9509 
  9510 /* Whether STRING only contains chars in the 0..127 range.  */
  9511 bool
  9512 string_ascii_p (Lisp_Object string)
  9513 {
  9514   ptrdiff_t nbytes = SBYTES (string);
  9515   for (ptrdiff_t i = 0; i < nbytes; i++)
  9516     if (SREF (string, i) > 127)
  9517       return false;
  9518   return true;
  9519 }
  9520 
  9521 Lisp_Object
  9522 code_convert_string (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object coding_system,
  9523                      Lisp_Object dst_object, bool encodep, bool nocopy,
  9524                      bool norecord)
  9525 {
  9526   struct coding_system coding;
  9527   ptrdiff_t chars, bytes;
  9528 
  9529   CHECK_STRING (string);
  9530   if (NILP (coding_system))
  9531     {
  9532       if (! norecord)
  9533         Vlast_coding_system_used = Qno_conversion;
  9534       if (NILP (dst_object))
  9535         return nocopy ? string : Fcopy_sequence (string);
  9536     }
  9537 
  9538   if (NILP (coding_system))
  9539     coding_system = Qno_conversion;
  9540   else
  9541     CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM (coding_system);
  9542   if (NILP (dst_object))
  9543     dst_object = Qt;
  9544   else if (! EQ (dst_object, Qt))
  9545     CHECK_BUFFER (dst_object);
  9546 
  9547   setup_coding_system (coding_system, &coding);
