  9548   coding.mode |= CODING_MODE_LAST_BLOCK;
  9549   chars = SCHARS (string);
  9550   bytes = SBYTES (string);
  9551 
  9552   if (EQ (dst_object, Qt))
  9553     {
  9554       /* Fast path for ASCII-only input and an ASCII-compatible coding:
  9555          act as identity if no EOL conversion is needed.  */
  9556       Lisp_Object attrs = CODING_ID_ATTRS (coding.id);
  9557       if (! NILP (CODING_ATTR_ASCII_COMPAT (attrs))
  9558           && (STRING_MULTIBYTE (string)
  9559               ? (chars == bytes) : string_ascii_p (string))
  9560           && (EQ (CODING_ID_EOL_TYPE (coding.id), Qunix)
  9561               || inhibit_eol_conversion
  9562               || ! memchr (SDATA (string), encodep ? '\n' : '\r', bytes)))
  9563         {
  9564           if (! norecord)
  9565             Vlast_coding_system_used = coding_system;
  9566           return (nocopy
  9567                   ? string
  9568                   : (encodep
  9569                      ? make_unibyte_string (SSDATA (string), bytes)
  9570                      : make_multibyte_string (SSDATA (string), bytes, bytes)));
  9571         }
  9572     }
  9573   else if (BUFFERP (dst_object))
  9574     {
  9575       struct buffer *buf = XBUFFER (dst_object);
  9576       ptrdiff_t buf_pt = BUF_PT (buf);
  9577 
  9578       invalidate_buffer_caches (buf, buf_pt, buf_pt);
  9579     }
  9580 
  9581   if (encodep)
  9582     encode_coding_object (&coding, string, 0, 0, chars, bytes, dst_object);
  9583   else
  9584     decode_coding_object (&coding, string, 0, 0, chars, bytes, dst_object);
  9585   if (! norecord)
  9586     Vlast_coding_system_used = CODING_ID_NAME (coding.id);
  9587 
  9588   return (BUFFERP (dst_object)
  9589           ? make_fixnum (coding.produced_char)
  9590           : coding.dst_object);
  9591 }
  9592 
  9593 
  9594 /* Encode or decode STRING according to CODING_SYSTEM.
  9595    Do not set Vlast_coding_system_used.  */
  9596 
  9597 Lisp_Object
  9598 code_convert_string_norecord (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object coding_system,
  9599                               bool encodep)
  9600 {
  9601   return code_convert_string (string, coding_system, Qt, encodep, 0, 1);
  9602 }
  9603 
  9604 
  9605 /* Return the gap address of BUFFER.  If the gap size is less than
  9606    NBYTES, enlarge the gap in advance.  */
  9607 
  9608 static unsigned char *
  9609 get_buffer_gap_address (Lisp_Object buffer, ptrdiff_t nbytes)
  9610 {
  9611   struct buffer *buf = XBUFFER (buffer);
  9612 
  9613   if (BUF_GPT (buf) != BUF_PT (buf))
  9614     {
  9615       struct buffer *oldb = current_buffer;
  9616 
  9617       current_buffer = buf;
  9618       move_gap_both (PT, PT_BYTE);
  9619       current_buffer = oldb;
  9620     }
  9621   if (BUF_GAP_SIZE (buf) < nbytes)
  9622     make_gap_1 (buf, nbytes);
  9623   return BUF_GPT_ADDR (buf);
  9624 }
  9625 
  9626 /* Return a pointer to the byte sequence for C, and its byte length in
  9627    LEN.  This function is used to get a byte sequence for HANDLE_8_BIT
  9628    and HANDLE_OVER_UNI arguments of encode_string_utf_8 and
  9629    decode_string_utf_8 when those arguments are given by
  9630    characters.  */
  9631 
  9632 static unsigned char *
  9633 get_char_bytes (int c, int *len)
  9634 {
  9635   /* Use two caches, since encode/decode_string_utf_8 are called
  9636      repeatedly with the same values for HANDLE_8_BIT and
  9637      HANDLE_OVER_UNI arguments.  */
  9638   static int chars[2];
  9639   static unsigned char bytes[2][6];
  9640   static int nbytes[2];
  9641   static int last_index;
  9642 
  9643   if (chars[last_index] == c)
  9644     {
  9645       *len = nbytes[last_index];
  9646       return bytes[last_index];
  9647     }
  9648   if (chars[1 - last_index] == c)
  9649     {
  9650       *len = nbytes[1 - last_index];
  9651       return bytes[1 - last_index];
  9652     }
  9653   last_index = 1 - last_index;
  9654   chars[last_index] = c;
  9655   *len = nbytes[last_index] = CHAR_STRING (c, bytes[last_index]);
  9656   return bytes[last_index];
  9657 }
  9658 
  9659 /* Encode STRING by the coding system utf-8-unix.
  9660 
  9661    This function is optimized for speed when the input string is
  9662    already a valid sequence of Unicode codepoints in the internal
  9663    representation, i.e. there are neither 8-bit raw bytes nor
  9664    characters beyond the Unicode range in the string's contents.
  9665 
  9666    Ignore any :pre-write-conversion and :encode-translation-table
  9667    properties.
  9668 
  9669    Assume that arguments have values as described below.
  9670    The validity must be enforced and ensured by the caller.
  9671 
  9672    STRING is a multibyte string or an ASCII-only unibyte string.
  9673 
  9674    BUFFER is a unibyte buffer or Qnil.
  9675 
  9676    If BUFFER is a unibyte buffer, insert the encoded result
  9677    after point of the buffer, and return the number of
  9678    inserted characters.  The caller should have made BUFFER ready for
  9679    modifying in advance (e.g., by calling invalidate_buffer_caches).
  9680 
  9681    If BUFFER is nil, return a unibyte string from the encoded result.
  9682 
  9683    If NOCOPY is non-zero, and if STRING contains only Unicode
  9684    characters (i.e., the encoding does not change the byte sequence),
  9685    return STRING even if it is multibyte.  WARNING: This will return a
  9686    _multibyte_ string, something that callers might not expect, especially
  9687    if STRING is not pure-ASCII; only use NOCOPY non-zero if the caller
  9688    will only use the byte sequence of the encoded result accessed by
  9689    SDATA or SSDATA, and the original STRING will _not_ be modified after
  9690    the encoding.  When in doubt, always pass NOCOPY as zero.  You _have_
  9691    been warned!
  9692 
  9693    HANDLE-8-BIT and HANDLE-OVER-UNI specify how to handle a non-Unicode
  9694    character in STRING.  The former is for an eight-bit character (represented
  9695    by a 2-byte overlong sequence in a multibyte STRING).  The latter is
  9696    for a codepoint beyond the end of the Unicode range (a character whose
  9697    code is greater than the maximum Unicode character 0x10FFFF, represented
  9698    by a 4 or 5-byte sequence in a multibyte STRING).
  9699 
  9700    If these two arguments are unibyte strings (typically
  9701    "\357\277\275", the UTF-8 sequence for the Unicode REPLACEMENT
  9702    CHARACTER #xFFFD), encode a non-Unicode character into that
  9703    unibyte sequence.
  9704 
  9705    If the two arguments are characters, encode a non-Unicode
  9706    character as the respective argument characters.
  9707 
  9708    If they are Qignored, skip a non-Unicode character.
  9709 
  9710    If HANDLE-8-BIT is Qt, encode eight-bit characters into single bytes
  9711    of the same value, like the usual Emacs encoding does.
  9712 
  9713    If HANDLE-OVER-UNI is Qt, encode characters beyond the Unicode
  9714    range into the same 4 or 5-byte sequence as used by Emacs
  9715    internally, like the usual Emacs encoding does.
  9716 
  9717    If the two arguments are Qnil, return Qnil if STRING has a
  9718    non-Unicode character.  This allows the caller to signal an error
  9719    if such input strings are not allowed.  */
  9720 
  9721 Lisp_Object
  9722 encode_string_utf_8 (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object buffer,
  9723                      bool nocopy, Lisp_Object handle_8_bit,
  9724                      Lisp_Object handle_over_uni)
  9725 {
  9726   ptrdiff_t nchars = SCHARS (string), nbytes = SBYTES (string);
  9727   if (NILP (buffer) && nchars == nbytes && nocopy)
  9728     /* STRING contains only ASCII characters.  */
  9729     return string;
  9730 
  9731   ptrdiff_t num_8_bit = 0;   /* number of eight-bit chars in STRING */
  9732   /* The following two vars are counted only if handle_over_uni is not Qt.  */
  9733   ptrdiff_t num_over_4 = 0; /* number of 4-byte non-Unicode chars in STRING */
  9734   ptrdiff_t num_over_5 = 0; /* number of 5-byte non-Unicode chars in STRING */
  9735   ptrdiff_t outbytes;        /* number of bytes of decoding result */
  9736   unsigned char *p = SDATA (string);
  9737   unsigned char *pend = p + nbytes;
  9738   unsigned char *src = NULL, *dst = NULL;
  9739   unsigned char *replace_8_bit = NULL, *replace_over_uni = NULL;
  9740   int replace_8_bit_len = 0, replace_over_uni_len = 0;
  9741   Lisp_Object val;              /* the return value */
  9742 
  9743   /* Scan bytes in STRING twice.  The first scan is to count non-Unicode
  9744      characters, and the second scan is to encode STRING.  If the
  9745      encoding is trivial (no need of changing the byte sequence),
  9746      the second scan is avoided.  */
  9747   for (int scan_count = 0; scan_count < 2; scan_count++)
  9748     {
  9749       while (p < pend)
  9750         {
  9751           if (nchars == pend - p)
  9752             /* There is no multibyte character remaining.  */
  9753             break;
  9754 
  9755           int c = *p;
  9756           int len = BYTES_BY_CHAR_HEAD (c);
  9757 
  9758           nchars--;
  9759           if (len == 1
  9760               || len == 3
  9761               || (len == 2 ? ! CHAR_BYTE8_HEAD_P (c)
  9762                   : (EQ (handle_over_uni, Qt)
  9763                      || (len == 4
  9764                          && STRING_CHAR (p) <= MAX_UNICODE_CHAR))))
  9765             {
  9766               p += len;
  9767               continue;
  9768             }
  9769 
  9770           /* A character to change the byte sequence on encoding was
  9771              found.  A rare case.  */
  9772           if (len == 2)
  9773             {
  9774               /* Handle an eight-bit character by handle_8_bit.  */
  9775               if (scan_count == 0)
  9776                 {
  9777                   if (NILP (handle_8_bit))
  9778                     return Qnil;
  9779                   num_8_bit++;
  9780                 }
  9781               else
  9782                 {
  9783                   if (src < p)
  9784                     {
  9785                       memcpy (dst, src, p - src);
  9786                       dst += p - src;
  9787                     }
  9788                   if (replace_8_bit_len > 0)
  9789                     {
  9790                       memcpy (dst, replace_8_bit, replace_8_bit_len);
  9791                       dst += replace_8_bit_len;
  9792                     }
  9793                   else if (EQ (handle_8_bit, Qt))
  9794                     {
  9795                       int char8 = STRING_CHAR (p);
  9796                       *dst++ = CHAR_TO_BYTE8 (char8);
  9797                     }
  9798                 }
  9799             }
  9800           else                  /* len == 4 or 5 */
  9801             {
  9802               /* Handle an over-unicode character by handle_over_uni.  */
  9803               if (scan_count == 0)
  9804                 {
  9805                   if (NILP (handle_over_uni))
  9806                     return Qnil;
  9807                   if (len == 4)
  9808                     num_over_4++;
  9809                   else
  9810                     num_over_5++;
  9811                 }
  9812               else
  9813                 {
  9814                   if (src < p)
  9815                     {
  9816                       memcpy (dst, src, p - src);
  9817                       dst += p - src;
  9818                     }
  9819                   if (replace_over_uni_len > 0)
  9820                     {
  9821                       memcpy (dst, replace_over_uni, replace_over_uni_len);
  9822                       dst += replace_over_uni_len;
  9823                     }
  9824                 }
  9825             }
  9826           p += len;
  9827           src = p;
  9828         }
  9829 
  9830       if (scan_count == 0)
  9831         {
  9832           /* End of the first scan.  */
  9833           outbytes = nbytes;
  9834           if (num_8_bit == 0
  9835               && (num_over_4 + num_over_5 == 0 || EQ (handle_over_uni, Qt)))
  9836             {
  9837               /* We can break the loop because there is no need of
  9838                  changing the byte sequence.  This is the typical
  9839                  case.  */
  9840               scan_count = 1;
  9841             }
  9842           else
  9843             {
  9844               /* Prepare for handling non-Unicode characters during
  9845                  the next scan.  */
  9846               if (num_8_bit > 0)
  9847                 {
  9848                   if (CHARACTERP (handle_8_bit))
  9849                     replace_8_bit = get_char_bytes (XFIXNUM (handle_8_bit),
  9850                                                     &replace_8_bit_len);
  9851                   else if (STRINGP (handle_8_bit))
  9852                     {
  9853                       replace_8_bit = SDATA (handle_8_bit);
  9854                       replace_8_bit_len = SBYTES (handle_8_bit);
  9855                     }
  9856                   if (replace_8_bit)
  9857                     outbytes += (replace_8_bit_len - 2) * num_8_bit;
  9858                   else if (EQ (handle_8_bit, Qignored))
  9859                     outbytes -= 2 * num_8_bit;
  9860                   else if (EQ (handle_8_bit, Qt))
  9861                     outbytes -= num_8_bit;
  9862                   else
  9863                     return Qnil;
  9864                 }
  9865               if (num_over_4 + num_over_5 > 0)
  9866                 {
  9867                   if (CHARACTERP (handle_over_uni))
  9868                     replace_over_uni = get_char_bytes (XFIXNUM (handle_over_uni),
  9869                                                        &replace_over_uni_len);
  9870                   else if (STRINGP (handle_over_uni))
  9871                     {
  9872                       replace_over_uni = SDATA (handle_over_uni);
  9873                       replace_over_uni_len = SBYTES (handle_over_uni);
  9874                     }
  9875                   if (num_over_4 > 0)
  9876                     {
  9877                       if (replace_over_uni)
  9878                         outbytes += (replace_over_uni_len - 4) * num_over_4;
  9879                       else if (EQ (handle_over_uni, Qignored))
  9880                         outbytes -= 4 * num_over_4;
  9881                       else if (! EQ (handle_over_uni, Qt))
  9882                         return Qnil;
  9883                     }
  9884                   if (num_over_5 > 0)
  9885                     {
  9886                       if (replace_over_uni)
  9887                         outbytes += (replace_over_uni_len - 5) * num_over_5;
  9888                       else if (EQ (handle_over_uni, Qignored))
  9889                         outbytes -= 5 * num_over_5;
  9890                       else if (! EQ (handle_over_uni, Qt))
  9891                         return Qnil;
  9892                     }
  9893                 }
  9894             }
  9895 
  9896           /* Prepare return value and space to store the encoded bytes.  */
  9897           if (BUFFERP (buffer))
  9898             {
  9899               val = make_fixnum (outbytes);
  9900               dst = get_buffer_gap_address (buffer, nbytes);
  9901             }
  9902           else
  9903             {
  9904               if (nocopy && (num_8_bit + num_over_4 + num_over_5) == 0)
  9905                 return string;
  9906               val = make_uninit_string (outbytes);
  9907               dst = SDATA (val);
  9908             }
  9909           p = src = SDATA (string);
  9910         }
  9911     }
  9912 
  9913   if (src < pend)
  9914     memcpy (dst, src, pend - src);
  9915   if (BUFFERP (buffer))
  9916     {
  9917       struct buffer *oldb = current_buffer;
  9918 
  9919       current_buffer = XBUFFER (buffer);
  9920       insert_from_gap (outbytes, outbytes, false);
  9921       current_buffer = oldb;
  9922     }
  9923   return val;
  9924 }
  9925 
  9926 /* Decode input string by the coding system utf-8-unix.
  9927 
  9928    This function is optimized for speed when the input string is
  9929    already a valid UTF-8 sequence, i.e. there are neither 8-bit raw
  9930    bytes nor any UTF-8 sequences longer than 4 bytes in the string's
  9931    contents.
  9932 
  9933    Ignore any :post-read-conversion and :decode-translation-table
  9934    properties.
  9935 
  9936    Assume that arguments have values as described below.
  9937    The validity must be enforced and ensured by the caller.
  9938 
  9939    STRING is a unibyte string, an ASCII-only multibyte string, or Qnil.
  9940    If STRING is Qnil, the input is a C string pointed by STR whose
  9941    length in bytes is in STR_LEN.
  9942 
  9943    BUFFER is a multibyte buffer or Qnil.
  9944    If BUFFER is a multibyte buffer, insert the decoding result of
  9945    Unicode characters after point of the buffer, and return the number
  9946    of inserted characters.  The caller should have made BUFFER ready
  9947    for modifying in advance (e.g., by calling invalidate_buffer_caches).
  9948 
  9949    If BUFFER is Qnil, return a multibyte string from the decoded result.
  9950 
  9951    NOCOPY non-zero means it is OK to return the input STRING if it
  9952    contains only ASCII characters or only valid UTF-8 sequences of 2
  9953    to 4 bytes.  WARNING: This will return a _unibyte_ string, something
  9954    that callers might not expect, especially if STRING is not
  9955    pure-ASCII; only use NOCOPY non-zero if the caller will only use
  9956    the byte sequence of the decoded result accessed via SDATA or
  9957    SSDATA, and if the original STRING will _not_ be modified after the
  9958    decoding.  When in doubt, always pass NOCOPY as zero.  You _have_
  9959    been warned!
  9960 
  9961    If STRING is Qnil, and the original string is passed via STR, NOCOPY
  9962    is ignored.
  9963 
  9964    HANDLE-8-BIT and HANDLE-OVER-UNI specify how to handle a invalid
  9965    byte sequence.  The former is for a 1-byte invalid sequence that
  9966    violates the fundamental UTF-8 encoding rules.  The latter is for a
  9967    4 or 5-byte overlong sequences that Emacs internally uses to
  9968    represent characters beyond the Unicode range (characters whose
  9969    codepoints are greater than #x10FFFF).  Note that this function does
  9970    not in general treat such overlong UTF-8 sequences as invalid.
  9971 
  9972    If these two arguments are strings (typically a 1-char string of
  9973    the Unicode REPLACEMENT CHARACTER #xFFFD), decode an invalid byte
  9974    sequence into that string.  They must be multibyte strings if they
  9975    contain a non-ASCII character.
  9976 
  9977    If the two arguments are characters, decode an invalid byte
  9978    sequence into the corresponding multibyte representation of the
  9979    respective character.
  9980 
  9981    If they are Qignored, skip an invalid byte sequence without
  9982    producing anything in the decoded string.
  9983 
  9984    If HANDLE-8-BIT is Qt, decode a 1-byte invalid sequence into the
  9985    corresponding eight-bit multibyte representation, like the usual
  9986    Emacs decoding does.
  9987 
  9988    If HANDLE-OVER-UNI is Qt, decode a 4 or 5-byte overlong sequence
  9989    that follows Emacs' internal representation for a character beyond
  9990    Unicode range into the corresponding character, like the usual
  9991    Emacs decoding does.
  9992 
  9993    If the two arguments are Qnil, return Qnil if the input string has
  9994    raw bytes or overlong sequences.  This allows the caller to signal
  9995    an error if such inputs are not allowed.  */
  9996 
  9997 Lisp_Object
  9998 decode_string_utf_8 (Lisp_Object string, const char *str, ptrdiff_t str_len,
  9999                      Lisp_Object buffer, bool nocopy,
 10000                      Lisp_Object handle_8_bit, Lisp_Object handle_over_uni)
 10001 {
 10002   /* This is like BYTES_BY_CHAR_HEAD, but it is assured that C >= 0x80
 10003      and it returns 0 for an invalid sequence.  */
 10004 #define UTF_8_SEQUENCE_LENGTH(c)        \
 10005   ((c) < 0xC2 ? 0                       \
 10006    : (c) < 0xE0 ? 2                     \
 10007    : (c) < 0xF0 ? 3                     \
 10008    : (c) < 0xF8 ? 4                     \
 10009    : (c) == 0xF8 ? 5                    \
 10010    : 0)
 10011 
 10012   ptrdiff_t nbytes = STRINGP (string) ? SBYTES (string) : str_len;
 10013   unsigned char *p = STRINGP (string) ? SDATA (string) : (unsigned char *) str;
 10014   unsigned char *str_orig = p;
 10015   unsigned char *pend = p + nbytes;
 10016   ptrdiff_t num_8_bit = 0;   /* number of invalid 1-byte sequences */
 10017   ptrdiff_t num_over_4 = 0;  /* number of invalid 4-byte sequences */
 10018   ptrdiff_t num_over_5 = 0;  /* number of invalid 5-byte sequences */
 10019   ptrdiff_t outbytes = nbytes;  /* number of decoded bytes */
 10020   ptrdiff_t outchars = 0;    /* number of decoded characters */
 10021   unsigned char *src = NULL, *dst = NULL;
 10022   bool change_byte_sequence = false;
 10023 
 10024   /* Scan input bytes twice.  The first scan is to count invalid
 10025      sequences, and the second scan is to decode input.  If the
 10026      decoding is trivial (no need of changing the byte sequence),
 10027      the second scan is avoided.  */
 10028   while (p < pend)
 10029     {
 10030       src = p;
 10031       /* Try short cut for an ASCII-only case.  */
 10032       while (p < pend && *p < 0x80) p++;
 10033       outchars += (p - src);
 10034       if (p == pend)
 10035         break;
 10036       int c = *p;
 10037       outchars++;
 10038       int len = UTF_8_SEQUENCE_LENGTH (c);
 10039       /* len == 0, 2, 3, 4, 5.  */
 10040       if (UTF_8_EXTRA_OCTET_P (p[1])
 10041           && (len == 2
 10042               || (UTF_8_EXTRA_OCTET_P (p[2])
 10043                   && (len == 3
 10044                       || (UTF_8_EXTRA_OCTET_P (p[3])
 10045                           && len == 4
 10046                           && STRING_CHAR (p) <= MAX_UNICODE_CHAR)))))
 10047         {
 10048           p += len;
 10049           continue;
 10050         }
 10051 
 10052       /* A sequence to change on decoding was found.  A rare case.  */
 10053       if (len == 0)
 10054         {
 10055           if (NILP (handle_8_bit))
 10056             return Qnil;
 10057           num_8_bit++;
 10058           len = 1;
 10059         }
 10060       else                      /* len == 4 or 5 */
 10061         {
 10062           if (NILP (handle_over_uni))
 10063             return Qnil;
 10064           if (len == 4)
 10065             num_over_4++;
 10066           else
 10067             num_over_5++;
 10068         }
 10069       change_byte_sequence = true;
 10070       p += len;
 10071     }
 10072 
 10073   Lisp_Object val;           /* the return value */
 10074 
 10075   if (! change_byte_sequence
 10076       && NILP (buffer))
 10077     {
 10078       if (nocopy && STRINGP (string))
 10079         return string;
 10080       val = make_uninit_multibyte_string (outchars, outbytes);
 10081       memcpy (SDATA (val), str_orig, pend - str_orig);
 10082       return val;
 10083     }
 10084 
 10085   /* Count the number of resulting chars and bytes.  */
 10086   unsigned char *replace_8_bit = NULL, *replace_over_uni = NULL;
 10087   int replace_8_bit_len = 0, replace_over_uni_len = 0;
 10088 
 10089   if (change_byte_sequence)
 10090     {
 10091       if (num_8_bit > 0)
 10092         {
 10093           if (CHARACTERP (handle_8_bit))
 10094             replace_8_bit = get_char_bytes (XFIXNUM (handle_8_bit),
 10095                                             &replace_8_bit_len);
 10096           else if (STRINGP (handle_8_bit))
 10097             {
 10098               replace_8_bit = SDATA (handle_8_bit);
 10099               replace_8_bit_len = SBYTES (handle_8_bit);
 10100             }
 10101           if (replace_8_bit)
 10102             outbytes += (replace_8_bit_len - 1) * num_8_bit;
 10103           else if (EQ (handle_8_bit, Qignored))
 10104             {
 10105               outbytes -= num_8_bit;
 10106               outchars -= num_8_bit;
 10107             }
 10108           else /* EQ (handle_8_bit, Qt)) */
 10109             outbytes += num_8_bit;
 10110         }
 10111       else if (num_over_4 + num_over_5 > 0)
 10112         {
 10113           if (CHARACTERP (handle_over_uni))
 10114             replace_over_uni = get_char_bytes (XFIXNUM (handle_over_uni),
 10115                                                &replace_over_uni_len);
 10116           else if (STRINGP (handle_over_uni))
 10117             {
 10118               replace_over_uni = SDATA (handle_over_uni);
 10119               replace_over_uni_len = SBYTES (handle_over_uni);
 10120             }
 10121           if (num_over_4 > 0)
 10122             {
 10123               if (replace_over_uni)
 10124                 outbytes += (replace_over_uni_len - 4) * num_over_4;
 10125               else if (EQ (handle_over_uni, Qignored))
 10126                 {
 10127                   outbytes -= 4 * num_over_4;
 10128                   outchars -= num_over_4;
 10129                 }
 10130             }
 10131           if (num_over_5 > 0)
 10132             {
 10133               if (replace_over_uni)
 10134                 outbytes += (replace_over_uni_len - 5) * num_over_5;
 10135               else if (EQ (handle_over_uni, Qignored))
 10136                 {
 10137                   outbytes -= 5 * num_over_5;
 10138                   outchars -= num_over_5;
 10139                 }
 10140             }
 10141         }
 10142     }
 10143 
 10144   /* Prepare return value and  space to store the decoded bytes.  */
 10145   if (BUFFERP (buffer))
 10146     {
 10147       val = make_fixnum (outchars);
 10148       dst = get_buffer_gap_address (buffer, outbytes);
 10149     }
 10150   else
 10151     {
 10152       if (nocopy && (num_8_bit + num_over_4 + num_over_5) == 0
 10153           && STRINGP (string))
 10154         return string;
 10155       val = make_uninit_multibyte_string (outchars, outbytes);
 10156       dst = SDATA (val);
 10157     }
 10158 
 10159   src = str_orig;
 10160   if (change_byte_sequence)
 10161     {
 10162       p = src;
 10163       while (p < pend)
 10164         {
 10165           /* Try short cut for an ASCII-only case.  */
 10166           /* while (p < pend && *p < 0x80) p++; */
 10167           /* if (p == pend) */
 10168           /*   break; */
 10169           int c = *p;
 10170           if (c < 0x80)
 10171             {
 10172               p++;
 10173               continue;
 10174             }
 10175           int len = UTF_8_SEQUENCE_LENGTH (c);
 10176           if (len > 1)
 10177             {
 10178               int mlen;
 10179               for (mlen = 1; mlen < len && UTF_8_EXTRA_OCTET_P (p[mlen]);
 10180                    mlen++);
 10181               if (mlen == len
 10182                   && (len <= 3
 10183                       || (len == 4 && STRING_CHAR (p) <= MAX_UNICODE_CHAR)
 10184                       || EQ (handle_over_uni, Qt)))
 10185                 {
 10186                   p += len;
 10187                   continue;
 10188                 }
 10189             }
 10190 
 10191           if (src < p)
 10192             {
 10193               memcpy (dst, src, p - src);
 10194               dst += p - src;
 10195             }
 10196           if (len == 0)
 10197             {
 10198               if (replace_8_bit)
 10199                 {
 10200                   memcpy (dst, replace_8_bit, replace_8_bit_len);
 10201                   dst += replace_8_bit_len;
 10202                 }
 10203               else if (EQ (handle_8_bit, Qt))
 10204                 {
 10205                   dst += BYTE8_STRING (c, dst);
 10206                 }
 10207               len = 1;
 10208             }
 10209           else                  /* len == 4 or 5 */
 10210             {
 10211               /* Handle p[0]... by handle_over_uni.  */
 10212               if (replace_over_uni)
 10213                 {
 10214                   memcpy (dst, replace_over_uni, replace_over_uni_len);
 10215                   dst += replace_over_uni_len;
 10216                 }
 10217             }
 10218           p += len;
 10219           src = p;
 10220         }
 10221     }
 10222 
 10223   if (src < pend)
 10224     memcpy (dst, src, pend - src);
 10225   if (BUFFERP (buffer))
 10226     {
 10227       struct buffer *oldb = current_buffer;
 10228 
 10229       current_buffer = XBUFFER (buffer);
 10230       insert_from_gap (outchars, outbytes, false);
 10231       current_buffer = oldb;
 10232     }
 10233   return val;
 10234 }
 10235 
 10236 /* #define ENABLE_UTF_8_CONVERTER_TEST */
 10237 
 10238 #ifdef ENABLE_UTF_8_CONVERTER_TEST
 10239 
 10240 /* These functions are useful for testing and benchmarking
 10241    encode_string_utf_8 and decode_string_utf_8.  */
 10242 
 10243 /* ENCODE_METHOD specifies which internal decoder to use.
 10244    If it is Qnil, use encode_string_utf_8.
 10245    Otherwise, use code_convert_string.
 10246 
 10247    COUNT, if integer, specifies how many times to call those functions
 10248    with the same arguments (for benchmarking). */
 10249 
 10250 DEFUN ("internal-encode-string-utf-8", Finternal_encode_string_utf_8,
 10251        Sinternal_encode_string_utf_8, 7, 7, 0,
 10252        doc: /* Internal use only.*/)
 10253   (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object buffer, Lisp_Object nocopy,
 10254    Lisp_Object handle_8_bit, Lisp_Object handle_over_uni,
 10255    Lisp_Object encode_method, Lisp_Object count)
 10256 {
 10257   int repeat_count;
 10258   Lisp_Object val;
 10259 
 10260   /* Check arguments.  Return Qnil when an argument is invalid.  */
 10261   if (! STRINGP (string))
 10262     return Qnil;
 10263   if (! NILP (buffer)
 10264       && (! BUFFERP (buffer)
 10265           || ! NILP (BVAR (XBUFFER (buffer), enable_multibyte_characters))))
 10266     return Qnil;
 10267   if (! NILP (handle_8_bit) && ! EQ (handle_8_bit, Qt)
 10268       && ! EQ (handle_8_bit, Qignored)
 10269       && ! CHARACTERP (handle_8_bit)
 10270       && (! STRINGP (handle_8_bit) || STRING_MULTIBYTE (handle_8_bit)))
 10271     return Qnil;
 10272   if (! NILP (handle_over_uni) && ! EQ (handle_over_uni, Qt)
 10273       && ! EQ (handle_over_uni, Qignored)
 10274       && ! CHARACTERP (handle_over_uni)
 10275       && (! STRINGP (handle_over_uni) || STRING_MULTIBYTE (handle_over_uni)))
 10276     return Qnil;
 10277 
 10278   CHECK_FIXNUM (count);
 10279   repeat_count = XFIXNUM (count);
 10280 
 10281   val = Qnil;
 10282   /* Run an encoder according to ENCODE_METHOD.  */
 10283   if (NILP (encode_method))
 10284     {
 10285       for (int i = 0; i < repeat_count; i++)
 10286         val = encode_string_utf_8 (string, buffer, ! NILP (nocopy),
 10287                                    handle_8_bit, handle_over_uni);
 10288     }
 10289   else
 10290     {
 10291       for (int i = 0; i < repeat_count; i++)
 10292         val = code_convert_string (string, Qutf_8_unix, Qnil, true,
 10293                                    ! NILP (nocopy), true);
 10294     }
 10295   return val;
 10296 }
 10297 
 10298 /* DECODE_METHOD specifies which internal decoder to use.
 10299    If it is Qnil, use decode_string_utf_8.
 10300    If it is Qt, use code_convert_string.
 10301    Otherwise, use make_string_from_utf8.
 10302 
 10303    COUNT, if integer, specifies how many times to call those functions
 10304    with the same arguments (for benchmarking).  */
 10305 
 10306 DEFUN ("internal-decode-string-utf-8", Finternal_decode_string_utf_8,
 10307        Sinternal_decode_string_utf_8, 7, 7, 0,
 10308        doc: /* Internal use only.*/)
 10309   (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object buffer, Lisp_Object nocopy,
 10310    Lisp_Object handle_8_bit, Lisp_Object handle_over_uni,
 10311    Lisp_Object decode_method, Lisp_Object count)
 10312 {
 10313   int repeat_count;
 10314   Lisp_Object val;
 10315 
 10316   /* Check arguments.  Return Qnil when an argument is invalid.  */
 10317   if (! STRINGP (string))
 10318     return Qnil;
 10319   if (! NILP (buffer)
 10320       && (! BUFFERP (buffer)
 10321           || NILP (BVAR (XBUFFER (buffer), enable_multibyte_characters))))
 10322     return Qnil;
 10323   if (! NILP (handle_8_bit) && ! EQ (handle_8_bit, Qt)
 10324       && ! EQ (handle_8_bit, Qignored)
 10325       && ! CHARACTERP (handle_8_bit)
 10326       && (! STRINGP (handle_8_bit) || ! STRING_MULTIBYTE (handle_8_bit)))
 10327     return Qnil;
 10328   if (! NILP (handle_over_uni) && ! EQ (handle_over_uni, Qt)
 10329       && ! EQ (handle_over_uni, Qignored)
 10330       && ! CHARACTERP (handle_over_uni)
 10331       && (! STRINGP (handle_over_uni) || ! STRING_MULTIBYTE (handle_over_uni)))
 10332     return Qnil;
 10333 
 10334   CHECK_FIXNUM (count);
 10335   repeat_count = XFIXNUM (count);
 10336 
 10337   val = Qnil;
 10338   /* Run a decoder according to DECODE_METHOD.  */
 10339   if (NILP (decode_method))
 10340     {
 10341       for (int i = 0; i < repeat_count; i++)
 10342         val = decode_string_utf_8 (string, buffer, ! NILP (nocopy),
 10343                                    handle_8_bit, handle_over_uni);
 10344     }
 10345   else if (EQ (decode_method, Qt))
 10346     {
 10347       if (! BUFFERP (buffer))
 10348         buffer = Qt;
 10349       for (int i = 0; i < repeat_count; i++)
 10350         val = code_convert_string (string, Qutf_8_unix, buffer, false,
 10351                                    ! NILP (nocopy), true);
 10352     }
 10353   else if (! NILP (decode_method))
 10354     {
 10355       for (int i = 0; i < repeat_count; i++)
 10356         val = make_string_from_utf8 ((char *) SDATA (string), SBYTES (string));
 10357     }
 10358   return val;
 10359 }
 10360 
 10361 #endif  /* ENABLE_UTF_8_CONVERTER_TEST */
 10362 
 10363 /* Encode or decode STRING using CODING_SYSTEM, with the possibility of
 10364    returning STRING itself if it equals the result.
 10365    Do not set Vlast_coding_system_used.  */
 10366 static Lisp_Object
 10367 convert_string_nocopy (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object coding_system,
 10368                        bool encodep)
 10369 {
 10370   return code_convert_string (string, coding_system, Qt, encodep, 1, 1);
 10371 }
 10372 
 10373 /* Encode or decode a file name, to or from a unibyte string suitable
 10374    for passing to C library functions.  */
 10375 Lisp_Object
 10376 decode_file_name (Lisp_Object fname)
 10377 {
 10378 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
 10379   /* The w32 build pretends to use UTF-8 for file-name encoding, and
 10380      converts the file names either to UTF-16LE or to the system ANSI
 10381      codepage internally, depending on the underlying OS; see w32.c.  */
 10382   if (! NILP (Fcoding_system_p (Qutf_8)))
 10383     return convert_string_nocopy (fname, Qutf_8, 0);
 10384   return fname;
 10385 #else  /* !WINDOWSNT */
 10386   if (! NILP (Vfile_name_coding_system))
 10387     return convert_string_nocopy (fname, Vfile_name_coding_system, 0);
 10388   else if (! NILP (Vdefault_file_name_coding_system))
 10389     return convert_string_nocopy (fname, Vdefault_file_name_coding_system, 0);
 10390   else
 10391     return fname;
 10392 #endif
 10393 }
 10394 
 10395 static Lisp_Object
 10396 encode_file_name_1 (Lisp_Object fname)
 10397 {
 10398   /* This is especially important during bootstrap and dumping, when
 10399      file-name encoding is not yet known, and therefore any non-ASCII
 10400      file names are unibyte strings, and could only be thrashed if we
 10401      try to encode them.  */
 10402   if (!STRING_MULTIBYTE (fname))
 10403     return fname;
 10404 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
 10405   /* The w32 build pretends to use UTF-8 for file-name encoding, and
 10406      converts the file names either to UTF-16LE or to the system ANSI
 10407      codepage internally, depending on the underlying OS; see w32.c.  */
 10408   if (! NILP (Fcoding_system_p (Qutf_8)))
 10409     return convert_string_nocopy (fname, Qutf_8, 1);
 10410   return fname;
 10411 #else  /* !WINDOWSNT */
 10412   if (! NILP (Vfile_name_coding_system))
 10413     return convert_string_nocopy (fname, Vfile_name_coding_system, 1);
 10414   else if (! NILP (Vdefault_file_name_coding_system))
 10415     return convert_string_nocopy (fname, Vdefault_file_name_coding_system, 1);
 10416   else
 10417     return fname;
 10418 #endif
 10419 }
 10420 
 10421 Lisp_Object
 10422 encode_file_name (Lisp_Object fname)
 10423 {
 10424   Lisp_Object encoded = encode_file_name_1 (fname);
 10425   /* No system accepts NUL bytes in filenames.  Allowing them can
 10426      cause subtle bugs because the system would silently use a
 10427      different filename than expected.  Perform this check after
 10428      encoding to not miss NUL bytes introduced through encoding.  */
 10429   CHECK_STRING_NULL_BYTES (encoded);
 10430   return encoded;
 10431 }
 10432 
 10433 DEFUN ("decode-coding-string", Fdecode_coding_string, Sdecode_coding_string,
 10434        2, 4, 0,
 10435        doc: /* Decode STRING which is encoded in CODING-SYSTEM, and return the result.
 10436 
 10437 Optional third arg NOCOPY non-nil means it is OK to return STRING itself
 10438 if the decoding operation is trivial.
 10439 
 10440 Optional fourth arg BUFFER non-nil means that the decoded text is
 10441 inserted in that buffer after point (point does not move).  In this
 10442 case, the return value is the length of the decoded text.  If that
 10443 buffer is unibyte, it receives the individual bytes of the internal
 10444 representation of the decoded text.
 10445 
 10446 This function sets `last-coding-system-used' to the precise coding system
 10447 used (which may be different from CODING-SYSTEM if CODING-SYSTEM is
 10448 not fully specified.)  The function does not change the match data.  */)
 10449   (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object coding_system, Lisp_Object nocopy, Lisp_Object buffer)
 10450 {
 10451   return code_convert_string (string, coding_system, buffer,
 10452                               0, ! NILP (nocopy), 0);
 10453 }
 10454 
 10455 DEFUN ("encode-coding-string", Fencode_coding_string, Sencode_coding_string,
 10456        2, 4, 0,
 10457        doc: /* Encode STRING to CODING-SYSTEM, and return the result.
 10458 
 10459 Optional third arg NOCOPY non-nil means it is OK to return STRING
 10460 itself if the encoding operation is trivial.
 10461 
 10462 Optional fourth arg BUFFER non-nil means that the encoded text is
 10463 inserted in that buffer after point (point does not move).  In this
 10464 case, the return value is the length of the encoded text.
 10465 
 10466 This function sets `last-coding-system-used' to the precise coding system
 10467 used (which may be different from CODING-SYSTEM if CODING-SYSTEM is
 10468 not fully specified.)  The function does not change the match data.  */)
 10469   (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object coding_system, Lisp_Object nocopy, Lisp_Object buffer)
 10470 {
 10471   return code_convert_string (string, coding_system, buffer,
 10472                               1, ! NILP (nocopy), 0);
 10473 }
 10474 
 10475 
 10476 DEFUN ("decode-sjis-char", Fdecode_sjis_char, Sdecode_sjis_char, 1, 1, 0,
 10477        doc: /* Decode a Japanese character which has CODE in shift_jis encoding.
 10478 Return the corresponding character.  */)
 10479   (Lisp_Object code)
 10480 {
 10481   Lisp_Object spec, attrs, val;
 10482   struct charset *charset_roman, *charset_kanji, *charset_kana, *charset;
 10483   EMACS_INT ch;
 10484   int c;
 10485 
 10486   CHECK_FIXNAT (code);
 10487   ch = XFIXNAT (code);
 10488   CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (Vsjis_coding_system, spec);
 10489   attrs = AREF (spec, 0);
 10490 
 10491   if (ASCII_CHAR_P (ch)
 10492       && ! NILP (CODING_ATTR_ASCII_COMPAT (attrs)))
 10493     return code;
 10494 
 10495   val = CODING_ATTR_CHARSET_LIST (attrs);
 10496   charset_roman = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (val))), val = XCDR (val);
 10497   charset_kana = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (val))), val = XCDR (val);
 10498   charset_kanji = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (val)));
 10499 
 10500   if (ch <= 0x7F)
 10501     {
 10502       c = ch;
 10503       charset = charset_roman;
 10504     }
 10505   else if (ch >= 0xA0 && ch < 0xDF)
 10506     {
 10507       c = ch - 0x80;
 10508       charset = charset_kana;
 10509     }
 10510   else
 10511     {
 10512       EMACS_INT c1 = ch >> 8;
 10513       int c2 = ch & 0xFF;
 10514 
 10515       if (c1 < 0x81 || (c1 > 0x9F && c1 < 0xE0) || c1 > 0xEF
 10516           || c2 < 0x40 || c2 == 0x7F || c2 > 0xFC)
 10517         error ("Invalid code: %"pI"d", ch);
 10518       c = ch;
 10519       SJIS_TO_JIS (c);
 10520       charset = charset_kanji;
 10521     }
 10522   c = DECODE_CHAR (charset, c);
 10523   if (c < 0)
 10524     error ("Invalid code: %"pI"d", ch);
 10525   return make_fixnum (c);
 10526 }
 10527 
 10528 
 10529 DEFUN ("encode-sjis-char", Fencode_sjis_char, Sencode_sjis_char, 1, 1, 0,
 10530        doc: /* Encode a Japanese character CH to shift_jis encoding.
 10531 Return the corresponding code in SJIS.  */)
 10532   (Lisp_Object ch)
 10533 {
 10534   Lisp_Object spec, attrs, charset_list;
 10535   int c;
 10536   struct charset *charset;
 10537   unsigned code;
 10538 
 10539   CHECK_CHARACTER (ch);
 10540   c = XFIXNAT (ch);
 10541   CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (Vsjis_coding_system, spec);
 10542   attrs = AREF (spec, 0);
 10543 
 10544   if (ASCII_CHAR_P (c)
 10545       && ! NILP (CODING_ATTR_ASCII_COMPAT (attrs)))
 10546     return ch;
 10547 
 10548   charset_list = CODING_ATTR_CHARSET_LIST (attrs);
 10549   charset = char_charset (c, charset_list, &code);
 10550   if (code == CHARSET_INVALID_CODE (charset))
 10551     error ("Can't encode by shift_jis encoding: %c", c);
 10552   JIS_TO_SJIS (code);
 10553 
 10554   return make_fixnum (code);
 10555 }
 10556 
 10557 DEFUN ("decode-big5-char", Fdecode_big5_char, Sdecode_big5_char, 1, 1, 0,
 10558        doc: /* Decode a Big5 character which has CODE in BIG5 coding system.
 10559 Return the corresponding character.  */)
 10560   (Lisp_Object code)
 10561 {
 10562   Lisp_Object spec, attrs, val;
 10563   struct charset *charset_roman, *charset_big5, *charset;
 10564   EMACS_INT ch;
 10565   int c;
 10566 
 10567   CHECK_FIXNAT (code);
 10568   ch = XFIXNAT (code);
 10569   CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (Vbig5_coding_system, spec);
 10570   attrs = AREF (spec, 0);
 10571 
 10572   if (ASCII_CHAR_P (ch)
 10573       && ! NILP (CODING_ATTR_ASCII_COMPAT (attrs)))
 10574     return code;
 10575 
 10576   val = CODING_ATTR_CHARSET_LIST (attrs);
 10577   charset_roman = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (val))), val = XCDR (val);
 10578   charset_big5 = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (val)));
 10579 
 10580   if (ch <= 0x7F)
 10581     {
 10582       c = ch;
 10583       charset = charset_roman;
 10584     }
 10585   else
 10586     {
 10587       EMACS_INT b1 = ch >> 8;
 10588       int b2 = ch & 0x7F;
 10589       if (b1 < 0xA1 || b1 > 0xFE
 10590           || b2 < 0x40 || (b2 > 0x7E && b2 < 0xA1) || b2 > 0xFE)
 10591         error ("Invalid code: %"pI"d", ch);
 10592       c = ch;
 10593       charset = charset_big5;
 10594     }
 10595   c = DECODE_CHAR (charset, c);
 10596   if (c < 0)
 10597     error ("Invalid code: %"pI"d", ch);
 10598   return make_fixnum (c);
 10599 }
 10600 
 10601 DEFUN ("encode-big5-char", Fencode_big5_char, Sencode_big5_char, 1, 1, 0,
 10602        doc: /* Encode the Big5 character CH to BIG5 coding system.
 10603 Return the corresponding character code in Big5.  */)
 10604   (Lisp_Object ch)
 10605 {
 10606   Lisp_Object spec, attrs, charset_list;
 10607   struct charset *charset;
 10608   int c;
 10609   unsigned code;
 10610 
 10611   CHECK_CHARACTER (ch);
 10612   c = XFIXNAT (ch);
 10613   CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (Vbig5_coding_system, spec);
 10614   attrs = AREF (spec, 0);
 10615   if (ASCII_CHAR_P (c)
 10616       && ! NILP (CODING_ATTR_ASCII_COMPAT (attrs)))
 10617     return ch;
 10618 
 10619   charset_list = CODING_ATTR_CHARSET_LIST (attrs);
 10620   charset = char_charset (c, charset_list, &code);
 10621   if (code == CHARSET_INVALID_CODE (charset))
 10622     error ("Can't encode by Big5 encoding: %c", c);
 10623 
 10624   return make_fixnum (code);
 10625 }
 10626 
 10627 
 10628 DEFUN ("set-terminal-coding-system-internal", Fset_terminal_coding_system_internal,
 10629        Sset_terminal_coding_system_internal, 1, 2, 0,
 10630        doc: /* Internal use only.  */)
 10631   (Lisp_Object coding_system, Lisp_Object terminal)
 10632 {
 10633   struct terminal *term = decode_live_terminal (terminal);
 10634   struct coding_system *terminal_coding = TERMINAL_TERMINAL_CODING (term);
 10635   CHECK_SYMBOL (coding_system);
 10636   setup_coding_system (Fcheck_coding_system (coding_system), terminal_coding);
 10637   /* We had better not send unsafe characters to terminal.  */
 10638   terminal_coding->mode |= CODING_MODE_SAFE_ENCODING;
 10639   /* Character composition should be disabled.  */
 10640   terminal_coding->common_flags &= ~CODING_ANNOTATE_COMPOSITION_MASK;
 10641   terminal_coding->src_multibyte = 1;
 10642   terminal_coding->dst_multibyte = 0;
 10643   tset_charset_list
 10644     (term, (terminal_coding->common_flags & CODING_REQUIRE_ENCODING_MASK
 10645             ? coding_charset_list (terminal_coding)
 10646             : list1i (charset_ascii)));
 10647   return Qnil;
 10648 }
 10649 
 10650 DEFUN ("set-safe-terminal-coding-system-internal",
 10651        Fset_safe_terminal_coding_system_internal,
 10652        Sset_safe_terminal_coding_system_internal, 1, 1, 0,
 10653        doc: /* Internal use only.  */)
 10654   (Lisp_Object coding_system)
 10655 {
 10656   CHECK_SYMBOL (coding_system);
 10657   setup_coding_system (Fcheck_coding_system (coding_system),
 10658                        &safe_terminal_coding);
 10659   /* Character composition should be disabled.  */
 10660   safe_terminal_coding.common_flags &= ~CODING_ANNOTATE_COMPOSITION_MASK;
 10661   safe_terminal_coding.src_multibyte = 1;
 10662   safe_terminal_coding.dst_multibyte = 0;
 10663   return Qnil;
 10664 }
 10665 
 10666 DEFUN ("terminal-coding-system", Fterminal_coding_system,
 10667        Sterminal_coding_system, 0, 1, 0,
 10668        doc: /* Return coding system specified for terminal output on the given terminal.
 10669 TERMINAL may be a terminal object, a frame, or nil for the selected
 10670 frame's terminal device.  */)
 10671   (Lisp_Object terminal)
 10672 {
 10673   struct coding_system *terminal_coding
 10674     = TERMINAL_TERMINAL_CODING (decode_live_terminal (terminal));
 10675   Lisp_Object coding_system = CODING_ID_NAME (terminal_coding->id);
 10676 
 10677   /* For backward compatibility, return nil if it is `undecided'.  */
 10678   return (! EQ (coding_system, Qundecided) ? coding_system : Qnil);
 10679 }
 10680 
 10681 DEFUN ("set-keyboard-coding-system-internal", Fset_keyboard_coding_system_internal,
 10682        Sset_keyboard_coding_system_internal, 1, 2, 0,
 10683        doc: /* Internal use only.  */)
 10684   (Lisp_Object coding_system, Lisp_Object terminal)
 10685 {
 10686   struct terminal *t = decode_live_terminal (terminal);
 10687   CHECK_SYMBOL (coding_system);
 10688   if (NILP (coding_system))
 10689     coding_system = Qno_conversion;
 10690   else
 10691     Fcheck_coding_system (coding_system);
 10692   setup_coding_system (coding_system, TERMINAL_KEYBOARD_CODING (t));
 10693   /* Character composition should be disabled.  */
 10694   TERMINAL_KEYBOARD_CODING (t)->common_flags
 10695     &= ~CODING_ANNOTATE_COMPOSITION_MASK;
 10696   return Qnil;
 10697 }
 10698 
 10699 DEFUN ("keyboard-coding-system",
 10700        Fkeyboard_coding_system, Skeyboard_coding_system, 0, 1, 0,
 10701        doc: /* Return coding system specified for decoding keyboard input.  */)
 10702   (Lisp_Object terminal)
 10703 {
 10704   return CODING_ID_NAME (TERMINAL_KEYBOARD_CODING
 10705                          (decode_live_terminal (terminal))->id);
 10706 }
 10707 
 10708 
 10709 DEFUN ("find-operation-coding-system", Ffind_operation_coding_system,
 10710        Sfind_operation_coding_system,  1, MANY, 0,
 10711        doc: /* Choose a coding system for an operation based on the target name.
 10712 The value names a pair of coding systems: (DECODING-SYSTEM . ENCODING-SYSTEM).
 10713 DECODING-SYSTEM is the coding system to use for decoding
 10714 \(in case OPERATION does decoding), and ENCODING-SYSTEM is the coding system
 10715 for encoding (in case OPERATION does encoding).
 10716 
 10717 The first argument OPERATION specifies an I/O primitive:
 10718   For file I/O, `insert-file-contents' or `write-region'.
 10719   For process I/O, `call-process', `call-process-region', or `start-process'.
 10720   For network I/O, `open-network-stream'.
 10721 
 10722 The remaining arguments should be the same arguments that were passed
 10723 to the primitive.  Depending on which primitive, one of those arguments
 10724 is selected as the TARGET.  For example, if OPERATION does file I/O,
 10725 whichever argument specifies the file name is TARGET.
 10726 
 10727 TARGET has a meaning which depends on OPERATION:
 10728   For file I/O, TARGET is a file name (except for the special case below).
 10729   For process I/O, TARGET is a process name.
 10730   For network I/O, TARGET is a service name or a port number.
 10731 
 10732 This function looks up what is specified for TARGET in
 10733 `file-coding-system-alist', `process-coding-system-alist',
 10734 or `network-coding-system-alist' depending on OPERATION.
 10735 They may specify a coding system, a cons of coding systems,
 10736 or a function symbol to call.
 10737 In the last case, we call the function with one argument,
 10738 which is a list of all the arguments given to this function.
 10739 If the function can't decide a coding system, it can return
 10740 `undecided' so that the normal code-detection is performed.
 10741 
 10742 If OPERATION is `insert-file-contents', the argument corresponding to
 10743 TARGET may be a cons (FILENAME . BUFFER).  In that case, FILENAME is a
 10744 file name to look up, and BUFFER is a buffer that contains the file's
 10745 contents (not yet decoded).  If `file-coding-system-alist' specifies a
 10746 function to call for FILENAME, that function should examine the
 10747 contents of BUFFER instead of reading the file.
 10748 
 10749 usage: (find-operation-coding-system OPERATION ARGUMENTS...)  */)
 10750   (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
 10751 {
 10752   Lisp_Object operation, target_idx, target, val;
 10753   register Lisp_Object chain;
 10754 
 10755   if (nargs < 2)
 10756     error ("Too few arguments");
 10757   operation = args[0];
 10758   if (!SYMBOLP (operation)
 10759       || (target_idx = Fget (operation, Qtarget_idx), !FIXNATP (target_idx)))
 10760     error ("Invalid first argument");
 10761   if (nargs <= 1 + XFIXNAT (target_idx))
 10762     error ("Too few arguments for operation `%s'",
 10763            SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (operation)));
 10764   target = args[XFIXNAT (target_idx) + 1];
 10765   if (!(STRINGP (target)
 10766         || (EQ (operation, Qinsert_file_contents) && CONSP (target)
 10767             && STRINGP (XCAR (target)) && BUFFERP (XCDR (target)))
 10768         || (EQ (operation, Qopen_network_stream)
 10769             && (FIXNUMP (target) || EQ (target, Qt)))))
 10770     error ("Invalid argument %"pI"d of operation `%s'",
 10771            XFIXNAT (target_idx) + 1, SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (operation)));
 10772   if (CONSP (target))
 10773     target = XCAR (target);
 10774 
 10775   chain = ((EQ (operation, Qinsert_file_contents)
 10776             || EQ (operation, Qwrite_region))
 10777            ? Vfile_coding_system_alist
 10778            : (EQ (operation, Qopen_network_stream)
 10779               ? Vnetwork_coding_system_alist
 10780               : Vprocess_coding_system_alist));
 10781   if (NILP (chain))
 10782     return Qnil;
 10783 
 10784   for (; CONSP (chain); chain = XCDR (chain))
 10785     {
 10786       Lisp_Object elt;
 10787 
 10788       elt = XCAR (chain);
 10789       if (CONSP (elt)
 10790           && ((STRINGP (target)
 10791                && STRINGP (XCAR (elt))
 10792                && fast_string_match (XCAR (elt), target) >= 0)
 10793               || (FIXNUMP (target) && BASE_EQ (target, XCAR (elt)))))
 10794         {
 10795           val = XCDR (elt);
 10796           /* Here, if VAL is both a valid coding system and a valid
 10797              function symbol, we return VAL as a coding system.  */
 10798           if (CONSP (val))
 10799             return val;
 10800           if (! SYMBOLP (val))
 10801             return Qnil;
 10802           if (! NILP (Fcoding_system_p (val)))
 10803             return Fcons (val, val);
 10804           if (! NILP (Ffboundp (val)))
 10805             {
 10806               /* We use call1 rather than safe_call1
 10807                  so as to get bug reports about functions called here
 10808                  which don't handle the current interface.  */
 10809               val = call1 (val, Flist (nargs, args));
 10810               if (CONSP (val))
 10811                 return val;
 10812               if (SYMBOLP (val) && ! NILP (Fcoding_system_p (val)))
 10813                 return Fcons (val, val);
 10814             }
 10815           return Qnil;
 10816         }
 10817     }
 10818   return Qnil;
 10819 }
 10820 
 10821 DEFUN ("set-coding-system-priority", Fset_coding_system_priority,
 10822        Sset_coding_system_priority, 0, MANY, 0,
 10823        doc: /* Assign higher priority to the coding systems given as arguments.
 10824 If multiple coding systems belong to the same category,
 10825 all but the first one are ignored.
 10826 
 10827 usage: (set-coding-system-priority &rest coding-systems)  */)
 10828   (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
 10829 {
 10830   ptrdiff_t i, j;
 10831   bool changed[coding_category_max];
 10832   enum coding_category priorities[coding_category_max];
 10833 
 10834   memset (changed, 0, sizeof changed);
 10835 
 10836   for (i = j = 0; i < nargs; i++)
 10837     {
 10838       enum coding_category category;
 10839       Lisp_Object spec, attrs;
 10840 
 10841       CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (args[i], spec);
 10842       attrs = AREF (spec, 0);
 10843       category = XFIXNUM (CODING_ATTR_CATEGORY (attrs));
 10844       if (changed[category])
 10845         /* Ignore this coding system because a coding system of the
 10846            same category already had a higher priority.  */
 10847         continue;
 10848       changed[category] = 1;
 10849       priorities[j++] = category;
 10850       if (coding_categories[category].id >= 0
 10851           && ! EQ (args[i], CODING_ID_NAME (coding_categories[category].id)))
 10852         setup_coding_system (args[i], &coding_categories[category]);
 10853       Fset (AREF (Vcoding_category_table, category), args[i]);
 10854     }
 10855 
 10856   /* Now we have decided top J priorities.  Reflect the order of the
 10857      original priorities to the remaining priorities.  */
 10858 
 10859   for (i = j, j = 0; i < coding_category_max; i++, j++)
 10860     {
 10861       while (j < coding_category_max
 10862              && changed[coding_priorities[j]])
 10863         j++;
 10864       if (j == coding_category_max)
 10865         emacs_abort ();
 10866       priorities[i] = coding_priorities[j];
 10867     }
 10868 
 10869   memcpy (coding_priorities, priorities, sizeof priorities);
 10870 
 10871   /* Update `coding-category-list'.  */
 10872   Vcoding_category_list = Qnil;
 10873   for (i = coding_category_max; i-- > 0; )
 10874     Vcoding_category_list
 10875       = Fcons (AREF (Vcoding_category_table, priorities[i]),
 10876                Vcoding_category_list);
 10877 
 10878   return Qnil;
 10879 }
 10880 
 10881 DEFUN ("coding-system-priority-list", Fcoding_system_priority_list,
 10882        Scoding_system_priority_list, 0, 1, 0,
 10883        doc: /* Return a list of coding systems ordered by their priorities.
 10884 The list contains a subset of coding systems; i.e. coding systems
 10885 assigned to each coding category (see `coding-category-list').
 10886 
 10887 HIGHESTP non-nil means just return the highest priority one.  */)
 10888   (Lisp_Object highestp)
 10889 {
 10890   int i;
 10891   Lisp_Object val;
 10892 
 10893   for (i = 0, val = Qnil; i < coding_category_max; i++)
 10894     {
 10895       enum coding_category category = coding_priorities[i];
 10896       int id = coding_categories[category].id;
 10897       Lisp_Object attrs;
 10898 
 10899       if (id < 0)
 10900         continue;
 10901       attrs = CODING_ID_ATTRS (id);
 10902       if (! NILP (highestp))
 10903         return CODING_ATTR_BASE_NAME (attrs);
 10904       val = Fcons (CODING_ATTR_BASE_NAME (attrs), val);
 10905     }
 10906   return Fnreverse (val);
 10907 }
 10908 
 10909 static Lisp_Object
 10910 make_subsidiaries (Lisp_Object base)
 10911 {
 10912   static char const suffixes[][8] = { "-unix", "-dos", "-mac" };
 10913   ptrdiff_t base_name_len = SBYTES (SYMBOL_NAME (base));
 10914   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
 10915   char *buf = SAFE_ALLOCA (base_name_len + 6);
 10916 
 10917   memcpy (buf, SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (base)), base_name_len);
 10918   Lisp_Object subsidiaries = make_nil_vector (3);
 10919   for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
 10920     {
 10921       strcpy (buf + base_name_len, suffixes[i]);
 10922       ASET (subsidiaries, i, intern (buf));
 10923     }
 10924   SAFE_FREE ();
 10925   return subsidiaries;
 10926 }
 10927 
 10928 
 10929 DEFUN ("define-coding-system-internal", Fdefine_coding_system_internal,
 10930        Sdefine_coding_system_internal, coding_arg_max, MANY, 0,
 10931        doc: /* For internal use only.
 10932 usage: (define-coding-system-internal ...)  */)
 10933   (ptrdiff_t nargs, Lisp_Object *args)
 10934 {
 10935   enum coding_category category;
 10936   int max_charset_id = 0;
 10937 
 10938   if (nargs < coding_arg_max)
 10939     goto short_args;
 10940 
 10941   Lisp_Object attrs = make_nil_vector (coding_attr_last_index);
 10942 
 10943   Lisp_Object name = args[coding_arg_name];
 10944   CHECK_SYMBOL (name);
 10945   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_base_name, name);
 10946 
 10947   Lisp_Object val = args[coding_arg_mnemonic];
 10948   /* decode_mode_spec_coding assumes the mnemonic is a single character.  */
 10949   if (STRINGP (val))
 10950     val = make_fixnum (STRING_CHAR (SDATA (val)));
 10951   else
 10952     CHECK_CHARACTER (val);
 10953   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_mnemonic, val);
 10954 
 10955   Lisp_Object coding_type = args[coding_arg_coding_type];
 10956   CHECK_SYMBOL (coding_type);
 10957   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_type, coding_type);
 10958 
 10959   Lisp_Object charset_list = args[coding_arg_charset_list];
 10960   if (SYMBOLP (charset_list))
 10961     {
 10962       if (EQ (charset_list, Qiso_2022))
 10963         {
 10964           if (! EQ (coding_type, Qiso_2022))
 10965             error ("Invalid charset-list");
 10966           charset_list = Viso_2022_charset_list;
 10967         }
 10968       else if (EQ (charset_list, Qemacs_mule))
 10969         {
 10970           if (! EQ (coding_type, Qemacs_mule))
 10971             error ("Invalid charset-list");
 10972           charset_list = Vemacs_mule_charset_list;
 10973         }
 10974       for (Lisp_Object tail = charset_list; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
 10975         {
 10976           if (! RANGED_FIXNUMP (0, XCAR (tail), INT_MAX - 1))
 10977             error ("Invalid charset-list");
 10978           if (max_charset_id < XFIXNAT (XCAR (tail)))
 10979             max_charset_id = XFIXNAT (XCAR (tail));
 10980         }
 10981     }
 10982   else
 10983     {
 10984       charset_list = Fcopy_sequence (charset_list);
 10985       for (Lisp_Object tail = charset_list; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
 10986         {
 10987           struct charset *charset;
 10988 
 10989           val = XCAR (tail);
 10990           CHECK_CHARSET_GET_CHARSET (val, charset);
 10991           if (EQ (coding_type, Qiso_2022)
 10992               ? CHARSET_ISO_FINAL (charset) < 0
 10993               : EQ (coding_type, Qemacs_mule)
 10994               ? CHARSET_EMACS_MULE_ID (charset) < 0
 10995               : 0)
 10996             error ("Can't handle charset `%s'",
 10997                    SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (CHARSET_NAME (charset))));
 10998 
 10999           XSETCAR (tail, make_fixnum (charset->id));
 11000           if (max_charset_id < charset->id)
 11001             max_charset_id = charset->id;
 11002         }
 11003     }
 11004   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_charset_list, charset_list);
 11005 
 11006   Lisp_Object safe_charsets = make_uninit_string (max_charset_id + 1);
 11007   memset (SDATA (safe_charsets), 255, max_charset_id + 1);
 11008   for (Lisp_Object tail = charset_list; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
 11009     SSET (safe_charsets, XFIXNAT (XCAR (tail)), 0);
 11010   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_safe_charsets, safe_charsets);
 11011 
 11012   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, args[coding_arg_ascii_compatible_p]);
 11013 
 11014   val = args[coding_arg_decode_translation_table];
 11015   if (! CHAR_TABLE_P (val) && ! CONSP (val))
 11016     CHECK_SYMBOL (val);
 11017   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_decode_tbl, val);
 11018 
 11019   val = args[coding_arg_encode_translation_table];
 11020   if (! CHAR_TABLE_P (val) && ! CONSP (val))
 11021     CHECK_SYMBOL (val);
 11022   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_encode_tbl, val);
 11023 
 11024   val = args[coding_arg_post_read_conversion];
 11025   CHECK_SYMBOL (val);
 11026   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_post_read, val);
 11027 
 11028   val = args[coding_arg_pre_write_conversion];
 11029   CHECK_SYMBOL (val);
 11030   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_pre_write, val);
 11031 
 11032   val = args[coding_arg_default_char];
 11033   if (NILP (val))
 11034     ASET (attrs, coding_attr_default_char, make_fixnum (' '));
 11035   else
 11036     {
 11037       CHECK_CHARACTER (val);
 11038       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_default_char, val);
 11039     }
 11040 
 11041   val = args[coding_arg_for_unibyte];
 11042   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_for_unibyte, NILP (val) ? Qnil : Qt);
 11043 
 11044   val = args[coding_arg_plist];
 11045   CHECK_LIST (val);
 11046   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_plist, val);
 11047 
 11048   if (EQ (coding_type, Qcharset))
 11049     {
 11050       /* Generate a lisp vector of 256 elements.  Each element is nil,
 11051          integer, or a list of charset IDs.
 11052 
 11053          If Nth element is nil, the byte code N is invalid in this
 11054          coding system.
 11055 
 11056          If Nth element is a number NUM, N is the first byte of a
 11057          charset whose ID is NUM.
 11058 
 11059          If Nth element is a list of charset IDs, N is the first byte
 11060          of one of them.  The list is sorted by dimensions of the
 11061          charsets.  A charset of smaller dimension comes first. */
 11062       val = make_nil_vector (256);
 11063 
 11064       for (Lisp_Object tail = charset_list; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
 11065         {
 11066           struct charset *charset = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNAT (XCAR (tail)));
 11067           int dim = CHARSET_DIMENSION (charset);
 11068           int idx = (dim - 1) * 4;
 11069 
 11070           if (CHARSET_ASCII_COMPATIBLE_P (charset))
 11071             ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, Qt);
 11072 
 11073           for (int i = charset->code_space[idx];
 11074                i <= charset->code_space[idx + 1]; i++)
 11075             {
 11076               Lisp_Object tmp, tmp2;
 11077               int dim2;
 11078 
 11079               tmp = AREF (val, i);
 11080               if (NILP (tmp))
 11081                 tmp = XCAR (tail);
 11082               else if (FIXNATP (tmp))
 11083                 {
 11084                   dim2 = CHARSET_DIMENSION (CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNAT (tmp)));
 11085                   if (dim < dim2)
 11086                     tmp = list2 (XCAR (tail), tmp);
 11087                   else
 11088                     tmp = list2 (tmp, XCAR (tail));
 11089                 }
 11090               else
 11091                 {
 11092                   for (tmp2 = tmp; CONSP (tmp2); tmp2 = XCDR (tmp2))
 11093                     {
 11094                       dim2 = CHARSET_DIMENSION (CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNAT (XCAR (tmp2))));
 11095                       if (dim < dim2)
 11096                         break;
 11097                     }
 11098                   if (NILP (tmp2))
 11099                     tmp = nconc2 (tmp, list1 (XCAR (tail)));
 11100                   else
 11101                     {
 11102                       XSETCDR (tmp2, Fcons (XCAR (tmp2), XCDR (tmp2)));
 11103                       XSETCAR (tmp2, XCAR (tail));
 11104                     }
 11105                 }
 11106               ASET (val, i, tmp);
 11107             }
 11108         }
 11109       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_charset_valids, val);
 11110       category = coding_category_charset;
 11111     }
 11112   else if (EQ (coding_type, Qccl))
 11113     {
 11114       Lisp_Object valids;
 11115 
 11116       if (nargs < coding_arg_ccl_max)
 11117         goto short_args;
 11118 
 11119       val = args[coding_arg_ccl_decoder];
 11120       CHECK_CCL_PROGRAM (val);
 11121       if (VECTORP (val))
 11122         val = Fcopy_sequence (val);
 11123       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ccl_decoder, val);
 11124 
 11125       val = args[coding_arg_ccl_encoder];
 11126       CHECK_CCL_PROGRAM (val);
 11127       if (VECTORP (val))
 11128         val = Fcopy_sequence (val);
 11129       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ccl_encoder, val);
 11130 
 11131       val = args[coding_arg_ccl_valids];
 11132       valids = Fmake_string (make_fixnum (256), make_fixnum (0), Qnil);
 11133       for (Lisp_Object tail = val; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
 11134         {
 11135           int from, to;
 11136 
 11137           val = XCAR (tail);
 11138           if (FIXNUMP (val))
 11139             {
 11140               if (! (0 <= XFIXNUM (val) && XFIXNUM (val) <= 255))
 11141                 args_out_of_range_3 (val, make_fixnum (0), make_fixnum (255));
 11142               from = to = XFIXNUM (val);
 11143             }
 11144           else
 11145             {
 11146               CHECK_CONS (val);
 11147               from = check_integer_range (XCAR (val), 0, 255);
 11148               to = check_integer_range (XCDR (val), from, 255);
 11149             }
 11150           for (int i = from; i <= to; i++)
 11151             SSET (valids, i, 1);
 11152         }
 11153       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ccl_valids, valids);
 11154 
 11155       category = coding_category_ccl;
 11156     }
 11157   else if (EQ (coding_type, Qutf_16))
 11158     {
 11159       Lisp_Object bom, endian;
 11160 
 11161       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, Qnil);
 11162 
 11163       if (nargs < coding_arg_utf16_max)
 11164         goto short_args;
 11165 
 11166       bom = args[coding_arg_utf16_bom];
 11167       if (! NILP (bom) && ! EQ (bom, Qt))
 11168         {
 11169           CHECK_CONS (bom);
 11170           val = XCAR (bom);
 11171           CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM (val);
 11172           val = XCDR (bom);
 11173           CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM (val);
 11174         }
 11175       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_utf_bom, bom);
 11176 
 11177       endian = args[coding_arg_utf16_endian];
 11178       CHECK_SYMBOL (endian);
 11179       if (NILP (endian))
 11180         endian = Qbig;
 11181       else if (! EQ (endian, Qbig) && ! EQ (endian, Qlittle))
 11182         error ("Invalid endian: %s", SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (endian)));
 11183       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_utf_16_endian, endian);
 11184 
 11185       category = (CONSP (bom)
 11186                   ? coding_category_utf_16_auto
 11187                   : NILP (bom)
 11188                   ? (EQ (endian, Qbig)
 11189                      ? coding_category_utf_16_be_nosig
 11190                      : coding_category_utf_16_le_nosig)
 11191                   : (EQ (endian, Qbig)
 11192                      ? coding_category_utf_16_be
 11193                      : coding_category_utf_16_le));
 11194     }
 11195   else if (EQ (coding_type, Qiso_2022))
 11196     {
 11197       Lisp_Object initial, reg_usage, request, flags;
 11198 
 11199       if (nargs < coding_arg_iso2022_max)
 11200         goto short_args;
 11201 
 11202       initial = Fcopy_sequence (args[coding_arg_iso2022_initial]);
 11203       CHECK_VECTOR (initial);
 11204       for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
 11205         {
 11206           val = AREF (initial, i);
 11207           if (! NILP (val))
 11208             {
 11209               struct charset *charset;
 11210 
 11211               CHECK_CHARSET_GET_CHARSET (val, charset);
 11212               ASET (initial, i, make_fixnum (CHARSET_ID (charset)));
 11213               if (i == 0 && CHARSET_ASCII_COMPATIBLE_P (charset))
 11214                 ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, Qt);
 11215             }
 11216           else
 11217             ASET (initial, i, make_fixnum (-1));
 11218         }
 11219 
 11220       reg_usage = args[coding_arg_iso2022_reg_usage];
 11221       CHECK_CONS (reg_usage);
 11222       CHECK_FIXNUM (XCAR (reg_usage));
 11223       CHECK_FIXNUM (XCDR (reg_usage));
 11224 
 11225       request = Fcopy_sequence (args[coding_arg_iso2022_request]);
 11226       for (Lisp_Object tail = request; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
 11227         {
 11228           int id;
 11229 
 11230           val = XCAR (tail);
 11231           CHECK_CONS (val);
 11232           CHECK_CHARSET_GET_ID (XCAR (val), id);
 11233           check_integer_range (XCDR (val), 0, 3);
 11234           XSETCAR (val, make_fixnum (id));
 11235         }
 11236 
 11237       flags = args[coding_arg_iso2022_flags];
 11238       CHECK_FIXNAT (flags);
 11239       int i = XFIXNUM (flags) & INT_MAX;
 11240       if (EQ (args[coding_arg_charset_list], Qiso_2022))
 11241         i |= CODING_ISO_FLAG_FULL_SUPPORT;
 11242       flags = make_fixnum (i);
 11243 
 11244       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_iso_initial, initial);
 11245       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_iso_usage, reg_usage);
 11246       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_iso_request, request);
 11247       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_iso_flags, flags);
 11248       setup_iso_safe_charsets (attrs);
 11249 
 11250       if (i & CODING_ISO_FLAG_SEVEN_BITS)
 11251         category = ((i & (CODING_ISO_FLAG_LOCKING_SHIFT
 11252                           | CODING_ISO_FLAG_SINGLE_SHIFT))
 11253                     ? coding_category_iso_7_else
 11254                     : EQ (args[coding_arg_charset_list], Qiso_2022)
 11255                     ? coding_category_iso_7
 11256                     : coding_category_iso_7_tight);
 11257       else
 11258         {
 11259           int id = XFIXNUM (AREF (initial, 1));
 11260 
 11261           category = (((i & CODING_ISO_FLAG_LOCKING_SHIFT)
 11262                        || EQ (args[coding_arg_charset_list], Qiso_2022)
 11263                        || id < 0)
 11264                       ? coding_category_iso_8_else
 11265                       : (CHARSET_DIMENSION (CHARSET_FROM_ID (id)) == 1)
 11266                       ? coding_category_iso_8_1
 11267                       : coding_category_iso_8_2);
 11268         }
 11269       if (category != coding_category_iso_8_1
 11270           && category != coding_category_iso_8_2)
 11271         ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, Qnil);
 11272     }
 11273   else if (EQ (coding_type, Qemacs_mule))
 11274     {
 11275       if (EQ (args[coding_arg_charset_list], Qemacs_mule))
 11276         ASET (attrs, coding_attr_emacs_mule_full, Qt);
 11277       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, Qt);
 11278       category = coding_category_emacs_mule;
 11279     }
 11280   else if (EQ (coding_type, Qshift_jis))
 11281     {
 11282       ptrdiff_t charset_list_len = list_length (charset_list);
 11283       if (charset_list_len != 3 && charset_list_len != 4)
 11284         error ("There should be three or four charsets");
 11285 
 11286       struct charset *charset = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (charset_list)));
 11287       if (CHARSET_DIMENSION (charset) != 1)
 11288         error ("Dimension of charset %s is not one",
 11289                SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (CHARSET_NAME (charset))));
 11290       if (CHARSET_ASCII_COMPATIBLE_P (charset))
 11291         ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, Qt);
 11292 
 11293       charset_list = XCDR (charset_list);
 11294       charset = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (charset_list)));
 11295       if (CHARSET_DIMENSION (charset) != 1)
 11296         error ("Dimension of charset %s is not one",
 11297                SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (CHARSET_NAME (charset))));
 11298 
 11299       charset_list = XCDR (charset_list);
 11300       charset = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (charset_list)));
 11301       if (CHARSET_DIMENSION (charset) != 2)
 11302         error ("Dimension of charset %s is not two",
 11303                SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (CHARSET_NAME (charset))));
 11304 
 11305       charset_list = XCDR (charset_list);
 11306       if (! NILP (charset_list))
 11307         {
 11308           charset = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (charset_list)));
 11309           if (CHARSET_DIMENSION (charset) != 2)
 11310             error ("Dimension of charset %s is not two",
 11311                    SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (CHARSET_NAME (charset))));
 11312         }
 11313 
 11314       category = coding_category_sjis;
 11315       Vsjis_coding_system = name;
 11316     }
 11317   else if (EQ (coding_type, Qbig5))
 11318     {
 11319       struct charset *charset;
 11320 
 11321       if (list_length (charset_list) != 2)
 11322         error ("There should be just two charsets");
 11323 
 11324       charset = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (charset_list)));
 11325       if (CHARSET_DIMENSION (charset) != 1)
 11326         error ("Dimension of charset %s is not one",
 11327                SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (CHARSET_NAME (charset))));
 11328       if (CHARSET_ASCII_COMPATIBLE_P (charset))
 11329         ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, Qt);
 11330 
 11331       charset_list = XCDR (charset_list);
 11332       charset = CHARSET_FROM_ID (XFIXNUM (XCAR (charset_list)));
 11333       if (CHARSET_DIMENSION (charset) != 2)
 11334         error ("Dimension of charset %s is not two",
 11335                SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (CHARSET_NAME (charset))));
 11336 
 11337       category = coding_category_big5;
 11338       Vbig5_coding_system = name;
 11339     }
 11340   else if (EQ (coding_type, Qraw_text))
 11341     {
 11342       category = coding_category_raw_text;
 11343       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, Qt);
 11344     }
 11345   else if (EQ (coding_type, Qutf_8))
 11346     {
 11347       Lisp_Object bom;
 11348 
 11349       if (nargs < coding_arg_utf8_max)
 11350         goto short_args;
 11351 
 11352       bom = args[coding_arg_utf8_bom];
 11353       if (! NILP (bom) && ! EQ (bom, Qt))
 11354         {
 11355           CHECK_CONS (bom);
 11356           val = XCAR (bom);
 11357           CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM (val);
 11358           val = XCDR (bom);
 11359           CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM (val);
 11360         }
 11361       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_utf_bom, bom);
 11362       if (NILP (bom))
 11363         ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, Qt);
 11364 
 11365       category = (CONSP (bom) ? coding_category_utf_8_auto
 11366                   : NILP (bom) ? coding_category_utf_8_nosig
 11367                   : coding_category_utf_8_sig);
 11368     }
 11369   else if (EQ (coding_type, Qundecided))
 11370     {
 11371       if (nargs < coding_arg_undecided_max)
 11372         goto short_args;
 11373       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_undecided_inhibit_null_byte_detection,
 11374             args[coding_arg_undecided_inhibit_null_byte_detection]);
 11375       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_undecided_inhibit_iso_escape_detection,
 11376             args[coding_arg_undecided_inhibit_iso_escape_detection]);
 11377       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_undecided_prefer_utf_8,
 11378             args[coding_arg_undecided_prefer_utf_8]);
 11379       category = coding_category_undecided;
 11380     }
 11381   else
 11382     error ("Invalid coding system type: %s",
 11383            SDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (coding_type)));
 11384 
 11385   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_category, make_fixnum (category));
 11386   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_plist,
 11387         Fcons (QCcategory,
 11388                Fcons (AREF (Vcoding_category_table, category),
 11389                       CODING_ATTR_PLIST (attrs))));
 11390   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_plist,
 11391         Fcons (QCascii_compatible_p,
 11392                Fcons (CODING_ATTR_ASCII_COMPAT (attrs),
 11393                       CODING_ATTR_PLIST (attrs))));
 11394 
 11395   Lisp_Object eol_type = args[coding_arg_eol_type];
 11396   if (! NILP (eol_type)
 11397       && ! EQ (eol_type, Qunix)
 11398       && ! EQ (eol_type, Qdos)
 11399       && ! EQ (eol_type, Qmac))
 11400     error ("Invalid eol-type");
 11401 
 11402   Lisp_Object aliases = list1 (name);
 11403 
 11404   if (NILP (eol_type))
 11405     {
 11406       eol_type = make_subsidiaries (name);
 11407       for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
 11408         {
 11409           Lisp_Object this_spec, this_name, this_aliases, this_eol_type;
 11410 
 11411           this_name = AREF (eol_type, i);
 11412           this_aliases = list1 (this_name);
 11413           this_eol_type = (i == 0 ? Qunix : i == 1 ? Qdos : Qmac);
 11414           this_spec = make_uninit_vector (3);
 11415           ASET (this_spec, 0, attrs);
 11416           ASET (this_spec, 1, this_aliases);
 11417           ASET (this_spec, 2, this_eol_type);
 11418           Fputhash (this_name, this_spec, Vcoding_system_hash_table);
 11419           Vcoding_system_list = Fcons (this_name, Vcoding_system_list);
 11420           val = Fassoc (Fsymbol_name (this_name), Vcoding_system_alist, Qnil);
 11421           if (NILP (val))
 11422             Vcoding_system_alist
 11423               = Fcons (Fcons (Fsymbol_name (this_name), Qnil),
 11424                        Vcoding_system_alist);
 11425         }
 11426     }
 11427 
 11428   Lisp_Object spec_vec = make_uninit_vector (3);
 11429   ASET (spec_vec, 0, attrs);
 11430   ASET (spec_vec, 1, aliases);
 11431   ASET (spec_vec, 2, eol_type);
 11432 
 11433   Fputhash (name, spec_vec, Vcoding_system_hash_table);
 11434   Vcoding_system_list = Fcons (name, Vcoding_system_list);
 11435   val = Fassoc (Fsymbol_name (name), Vcoding_system_alist, Qnil);
 11436   if (NILP (val))
 11437     Vcoding_system_alist = Fcons (Fcons (Fsymbol_name (name), Qnil),
 11438                                   Vcoding_system_alist);
 11439 
 11440   int id = coding_categories[category].id;
 11441   if (id < 0 || EQ (name, CODING_ID_NAME (id)))
 11442       setup_coding_system (name, &coding_categories[category]);
 11443 
 11444   return Qnil;
 11445 
 11446  short_args:
 11447   Fsignal (Qwrong_number_of_arguments,
