 11448            Fcons (intern ("define-coding-system-internal"),
 11449                   make_fixnum (nargs)));
 11450 }
 11451 
 11452 
 11453 DEFUN ("coding-system-put", Fcoding_system_put, Scoding_system_put,
 11454        3, 3, 0,
 11455        doc: /* Change value in CODING-SYSTEM's property list PROP to VAL.  */)
 11456   (Lisp_Object coding_system, Lisp_Object prop, Lisp_Object val)
 11457 {
 11458   Lisp_Object spec, attrs;
 11459 
 11460   CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (coding_system, spec);
 11461   attrs = AREF (spec, 0);
 11462   if (EQ (prop, QCmnemonic))
 11463     {
 11464       /* decode_mode_spec_coding assumes the mnemonic is a single character.  */
 11465       if (STRINGP (val))
 11466         val = make_fixnum (STRING_CHAR (SDATA (val)));
 11467       else
 11468         CHECK_CHARACTER (val);
 11469       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_mnemonic, val);
 11470     }
 11471   else if (EQ (prop, QCdefault_char))
 11472     {
 11473       if (NILP (val))
 11474         val = make_fixnum (' ');
 11475       else
 11476         CHECK_CHARACTER (val);
 11477       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_default_char, val);
 11478     }
 11479   else if (EQ (prop, QCdecode_translation_table))
 11480     {
 11481       if (! CHAR_TABLE_P (val) && ! CONSP (val))
 11482         CHECK_SYMBOL (val);
 11483       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_decode_tbl, val);
 11484     }
 11485   else if (EQ (prop, QCencode_translation_table))
 11486     {
 11487       if (! CHAR_TABLE_P (val) && ! CONSP (val))
 11488         CHECK_SYMBOL (val);
 11489       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_encode_tbl, val);
 11490     }
 11491   else if (EQ (prop, QCpost_read_conversion))
 11492     {
 11493       CHECK_SYMBOL (val);
 11494       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_post_read, val);
 11495     }
 11496   else if (EQ (prop, QCpre_write_conversion))
 11497     {
 11498       CHECK_SYMBOL (val);
 11499       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_pre_write, val);
 11500     }
 11501   else if (EQ (prop, QCascii_compatible_p))
 11502     {
 11503       ASET (attrs, coding_attr_ascii_compat, val);
 11504     }
 11505 
 11506   ASET (attrs, coding_attr_plist,
 11507         plist_put (CODING_ATTR_PLIST (attrs), prop, val));
 11508   return val;
 11509 }
 11510 
 11511 
 11512 DEFUN ("define-coding-system-alias", Fdefine_coding_system_alias,
 11513        Sdefine_coding_system_alias, 2, 2, 0,
 11514        doc: /* Define ALIAS as an alias for CODING-SYSTEM.  */)
 11515   (Lisp_Object alias, Lisp_Object coding_system)
 11516 {
 11517   Lisp_Object spec, aliases, eol_type, val;
 11518 
 11519   CHECK_SYMBOL (alias);
 11520   CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (coding_system, spec);
 11521   aliases = AREF (spec, 1);
 11522   /* ALIASES should be a list of length more than zero, and the first
 11523      element is a base coding system.  Append ALIAS at the tail of the
 11524      list.  */
 11525   while (!NILP (XCDR (aliases)))
 11526     aliases = XCDR (aliases);
 11527   XSETCDR (aliases, list1 (alias));
 11528 
 11529   eol_type = AREF (spec, 2);
 11530   if (VECTORP (eol_type))
 11531     {
 11532       Lisp_Object subsidiaries;
 11533       int i;
 11534 
 11535       subsidiaries = make_subsidiaries (alias);
 11536       for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
 11537         Fdefine_coding_system_alias (AREF (subsidiaries, i),
 11538                                      AREF (eol_type, i));
 11539     }
 11540 
 11541   Fputhash (alias, spec, Vcoding_system_hash_table);
 11542   Vcoding_system_list = Fcons (alias, Vcoding_system_list);
 11543   val = Fassoc (Fsymbol_name (alias), Vcoding_system_alist, Qnil);
 11544   if (NILP (val))
 11545     Vcoding_system_alist = Fcons (Fcons (Fsymbol_name (alias), Qnil),
 11546                                   Vcoding_system_alist);
 11547 
 11548   return Qnil;
 11549 }
 11550 
 11551 DEFUN ("coding-system-base", Fcoding_system_base, Scoding_system_base,
 11552        1, 1, 0,
 11553        doc: /* Return the base of CODING-SYSTEM.
 11554 Any alias or subsidiary coding system is not a base coding system.  */)
 11555   (Lisp_Object coding_system)
 11556 {
 11557   Lisp_Object spec, attrs;
 11558 
 11559   if (NILP (coding_system))
 11560     return (Qno_conversion);
 11561   CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (coding_system, spec);
 11562   attrs = AREF (spec, 0);
 11563   return CODING_ATTR_BASE_NAME (attrs);
 11564 }
 11565 
 11566 DEFUN ("coding-system-plist", Fcoding_system_plist, Scoding_system_plist,
 11567        1, 1, 0,
 11568        doc: /* Return the property list of CODING-SYSTEM.  */)
 11569   (Lisp_Object coding_system)
 11570 {
 11571   Lisp_Object spec, attrs;
 11572 
 11573   if (NILP (coding_system))
 11574     coding_system = Qno_conversion;
 11575   CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (coding_system, spec);
 11576   attrs = AREF (spec, 0);
 11577   return CODING_ATTR_PLIST (attrs);
 11578 }
 11579 
 11580 
 11581 DEFUN ("coding-system-aliases", Fcoding_system_aliases, Scoding_system_aliases,
 11582        1, 1, 0,
 11583        doc: /* Return the list of aliases of CODING-SYSTEM.  */)
 11584   (Lisp_Object coding_system)
 11585 {
 11586   Lisp_Object spec;
 11587 
 11588   if (NILP (coding_system))
 11589     coding_system = Qno_conversion;
 11590   CHECK_CODING_SYSTEM_GET_SPEC (coding_system, spec);
 11591   return AREF (spec, 1);
 11592 }
 11593 
 11594 DEFUN ("coding-system-eol-type", Fcoding_system_eol_type,
 11595        Scoding_system_eol_type, 1, 1, 0,
 11596        doc: /* Return eol-type of CODING-SYSTEM.
 11597 An eol-type is an integer 0, 1, 2, or a vector of coding systems.
 11598 
 11599 Integer values 0, 1, and 2 indicate a format of end-of-line; LF, CRLF,
 11600 and CR respectively.
 11601 
 11602 A vector value indicates that a format of end-of-line should be
 11603 detected automatically.  Nth element of the vector is the subsidiary
 11604 coding system whose eol-type is N.  */)
 11605   (Lisp_Object coding_system)
 11606 {
 11607   Lisp_Object spec, eol_type;
 11608   int n;
 11609 
 11610   if (NILP (coding_system))
 11611     coding_system = Qno_conversion;
 11612   if (! CODING_SYSTEM_P (coding_system))
 11613     return Qnil;
 11614   spec = CODING_SYSTEM_SPEC (coding_system);
 11615   eol_type = AREF (spec, 2);
 11616   if (VECTORP (eol_type))
 11617     return Fcopy_sequence (eol_type);
 11618   n = EQ (eol_type, Qunix) ? 0 : EQ (eol_type, Qdos) ? 1 : 2;
 11619   return make_fixnum (n);
 11620 }
 11621 
 11622 
 11623 /*** 9. Post-amble ***/
 11624 
 11625 void
 11626 init_coding_once (void)
 11627 {
 11628   int i;
 11629 
 11630   for (i = 0; i < coding_category_max; i++)
 11631     {
 11632       coding_categories[i].id = -1;
 11633       coding_priorities[i] = i;
 11634     }
 11635 
 11636   PDUMPER_REMEMBER_SCALAR (coding_categories);
 11637   PDUMPER_REMEMBER_SCALAR (coding_priorities);
 11638 
 11639   /* ISO2022 specific initialize routine.  */
 11640   for (i = 0; i < 0x20; i++)
 11641     iso_code_class[i] = ISO_control_0;
 11642   for (i = 0x21; i < 0x7F; i++)
 11643     iso_code_class[i] = ISO_graphic_plane_0;
 11644   for (i = 0x80; i < 0xA0; i++)
 11645     iso_code_class[i] = ISO_control_1;
 11646   for (i = 0xA1; i < 0xFF; i++)
 11647     iso_code_class[i] = ISO_graphic_plane_1;
 11648   iso_code_class[0x20] = iso_code_class[0x7F] = ISO_0x20_or_0x7F;
 11649   iso_code_class[0xA0] = iso_code_class[0xFF] = ISO_0xA0_or_0xFF;
 11650   iso_code_class[ISO_CODE_SO] = ISO_shift_out;
 11651   iso_code_class[ISO_CODE_SI] = ISO_shift_in;
 11652   iso_code_class[ISO_CODE_SS2_7] = ISO_single_shift_2_7;
 11653   iso_code_class[ISO_CODE_ESC] = ISO_escape;
 11654   iso_code_class[ISO_CODE_SS2] = ISO_single_shift_2;
 11655   iso_code_class[ISO_CODE_SS3] = ISO_single_shift_3;
 11656   iso_code_class[ISO_CODE_CSI] = ISO_control_sequence_introducer;
 11657 
 11658   PDUMPER_REMEMBER_SCALAR (iso_code_class);
 11659 
 11660   for (i = 0; i < 256; i++)
 11661     {
 11662       emacs_mule_bytes[i] = 1;
 11663     }
 11664   emacs_mule_bytes[EMACS_MULE_LEADING_CODE_PRIVATE_11] = 3;
 11665   emacs_mule_bytes[EMACS_MULE_LEADING_CODE_PRIVATE_12] = 3;
 11666   emacs_mule_bytes[EMACS_MULE_LEADING_CODE_PRIVATE_21] = 4;
 11667   emacs_mule_bytes[EMACS_MULE_LEADING_CODE_PRIVATE_22] = 4;
 11668 
 11669   PDUMPER_REMEMBER_SCALAR (emacs_mule_bytes);
 11670 }
 11671 
 11672 static void reset_coding_after_pdumper_load (void);
 11673 
 11674 void
 11675 syms_of_coding (void)
 11676 {
 11677   staticpro (&Vcoding_system_hash_table);
 11678   Vcoding_system_hash_table = CALLN (Fmake_hash_table, QCtest, Qeq);
 11679 
 11680   staticpro (&Vsjis_coding_system);
 11681   Vsjis_coding_system = Qnil;
 11682 
 11683   staticpro (&Vbig5_coding_system);
 11684   Vbig5_coding_system = Qnil;
 11685 
 11686   staticpro (&Vcode_conversion_reused_workbuf);
 11687   Vcode_conversion_reused_workbuf = Qnil;
 11688 
 11689   staticpro (&Vcode_conversion_workbuf_name);
 11690   Vcode_conversion_workbuf_name = build_pure_c_string (" *code-conversion-work*");
 11691 
 11692   reused_workbuf_in_use = false;
 11693   PDUMPER_REMEMBER_SCALAR (reused_workbuf_in_use);
 11694 
 11695   DEFSYM (Qcharset, "charset");
 11696   DEFSYM (Qtarget_idx, "target-idx");
 11697   DEFSYM (Qcoding_system_history, "coding-system-history");
 11698   Fset (Qcoding_system_history, Qnil);
 11699 
 11700   /* Target FILENAME is the first argument.  */
 11701   Fput (Qinsert_file_contents, Qtarget_idx, make_fixnum (0));
 11702   /* Target FILENAME is the third argument.  */
 11703   Fput (Qwrite_region, Qtarget_idx, make_fixnum (2));
 11704 
 11705   DEFSYM (Qcall_process, "call-process");
 11706   /* Target PROGRAM is the first argument.  */
 11707   Fput (Qcall_process, Qtarget_idx, make_fixnum (0));
 11708 
 11709   DEFSYM (Qcall_process_region, "call-process-region");
 11710   /* Target PROGRAM is the third argument.  */
 11711   Fput (Qcall_process_region, Qtarget_idx, make_fixnum (2));
 11712 
 11713   DEFSYM (Qstart_process, "start-process");
 11714   /* Target PROGRAM is the third argument.  */
 11715   Fput (Qstart_process, Qtarget_idx, make_fixnum (2));
 11716 
 11717   DEFSYM (Qopen_network_stream, "open-network-stream");
 11718   /* Target SERVICE is the fourth argument.  */
 11719   Fput (Qopen_network_stream, Qtarget_idx, make_fixnum (3));
 11720 
 11721   DEFSYM (Qunix, "unix");
 11722   DEFSYM (Qdos, "dos");
 11723   DEFSYM (Qmac, "mac");
 11724 
 11725   DEFSYM (Qbuffer_file_coding_system, "buffer-file-coding-system");
 11726   DEFSYM (Qundecided, "undecided");
 11727   DEFSYM (Qno_conversion, "no-conversion");
 11728   DEFSYM (Qraw_text, "raw-text");
 11729   DEFSYM (Qus_ascii, "us-ascii");
 11730 
 11731   DEFSYM (Qiso_2022, "iso-2022");
 11732 
 11733   DEFSYM (Qutf_8, "utf-8");
 11734   DEFSYM (Qutf_8_unix, "utf-8-unix");
 11735   DEFSYM (Qutf_8_emacs, "utf-8-emacs");
 11736 
 11737 #if defined (WINDOWSNT) || defined (CYGWIN)
 11738   /* No, not utf-16-le: that one has a BOM.  */
 11739   DEFSYM (Qutf_16le, "utf-16le");
 11740 #endif
 11741 
 11742   DEFSYM (Qutf_16, "utf-16");
 11743   DEFSYM (Qbig, "big");
 11744   DEFSYM (Qlittle, "little");
 11745 
 11746   DEFSYM (Qshift_jis, "shift-jis");
 11747   DEFSYM (Qbig5, "big5");
 11748 
 11749   DEFSYM (Qcoding_system_p, "coding-system-p");
 11750 
 11751   /* Error signaled when there's a problem with detecting a coding system.  */
 11752   DEFSYM (Qcoding_system_error, "coding-system-error");
 11753   Fput (Qcoding_system_error, Qerror_conditions,
 11754         pure_list (Qcoding_system_error, Qerror));
 11755   Fput (Qcoding_system_error, Qerror_message,
 11756         build_pure_c_string ("Invalid coding system"));
 11757 
 11758   DEFSYM (Qtranslation_table, "translation-table");
 11759   Fput (Qtranslation_table, Qchar_table_extra_slots, make_fixnum (2));
 11760   DEFSYM (Qtranslation_table_id, "translation-table-id");
 11761 
 11762   /* Coding system emacs-mule and raw-text are for converting only
 11763      end-of-line format.  */
 11764   DEFSYM (Qemacs_mule, "emacs-mule");
 11765 
 11766   DEFSYM (QCcategory, ":category");
 11767   DEFSYM (QCmnemonic, ":mnemonic");
 11768   DEFSYM (QCdefault_char, ":default-char");
 11769   DEFSYM (QCdecode_translation_table, ":decode-translation-table");
 11770   DEFSYM (QCencode_translation_table, ":encode-translation-table");
 11771   DEFSYM (QCpost_read_conversion, ":post-read-conversion");
 11772   DEFSYM (QCpre_write_conversion, ":pre-write-conversion");
 11773   DEFSYM (QCascii_compatible_p, ":ascii-compatible-p");
 11774 
 11775   Vcoding_category_table = make_nil_vector (coding_category_max);
 11776   staticpro (&Vcoding_category_table);
 11777   /* Followings are target of code detection.  */
 11778   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_iso_7,
 11779         intern_c_string ("coding-category-iso-7"));
 11780   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_iso_7_tight,
 11781         intern_c_string ("coding-category-iso-7-tight"));
 11782   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_iso_8_1,
 11783         intern_c_string ("coding-category-iso-8-1"));
 11784   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_iso_8_2,
 11785         intern_c_string ("coding-category-iso-8-2"));
 11786   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_iso_7_else,
 11787         intern_c_string ("coding-category-iso-7-else"));
 11788   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_iso_8_else,
 11789         intern_c_string ("coding-category-iso-8-else"));
 11790   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_utf_8_auto,
 11791         intern_c_string ("coding-category-utf-8-auto"));
 11792   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_utf_8_nosig,
 11793         intern_c_string ("coding-category-utf-8"));
 11794   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_utf_8_sig,
 11795         intern_c_string ("coding-category-utf-8-sig"));
 11796   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_utf_16_be,
 11797         intern_c_string ("coding-category-utf-16-be"));
 11798   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_utf_16_auto,
 11799         intern_c_string ("coding-category-utf-16-auto"));
 11800   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_utf_16_le,
 11801         intern_c_string ("coding-category-utf-16-le"));
 11802   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_utf_16_be_nosig,
 11803         intern_c_string ("coding-category-utf-16-be-nosig"));
 11804   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_utf_16_le_nosig,
 11805         intern_c_string ("coding-category-utf-16-le-nosig"));
 11806   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_charset,
 11807         intern_c_string ("coding-category-charset"));
 11808   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_sjis,
 11809         intern_c_string ("coding-category-sjis"));
 11810   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_big5,
 11811         intern_c_string ("coding-category-big5"));
 11812   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_ccl,
 11813         intern_c_string ("coding-category-ccl"));
 11814   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_emacs_mule,
 11815         intern_c_string ("coding-category-emacs-mule"));
 11816   /* Followings are NOT target of code detection.  */
 11817   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_raw_text,
 11818         intern_c_string ("coding-category-raw-text"));
 11819   ASET (Vcoding_category_table, coding_category_undecided,
 11820         intern_c_string ("coding-category-undecided"));
 11821 
 11822   DEFSYM (Qinsufficient_source, "insufficient-source");
 11823   DEFSYM (Qinvalid_source, "invalid-source");
 11824   DEFSYM (Qinterrupted, "interrupted");

 11826   /* If a symbol has this property, evaluate the value to define the
 11827      symbol as a coding system.  */
 11828   DEFSYM (Qcoding_system_define_form, "coding-system-define-form");

 11835   defsubr (&Scoding_system_p);

 11837   defsubr (&Sread_non_nil_coding_system);
 11838   defsubr (&Scheck_coding_system);
 11839   defsubr (&Sdetect_coding_region);
 11840   defsubr (&Sdetect_coding_string);
 11841   defsubr (&Sfind_coding_systems_region_internal);
 11842   defsubr (&Sunencodable_char_position);
 11843   defsubr (&Scheck_coding_systems_region);
 11844   defsubr (&Sdecode_coding_region);
 11845   defsubr (&Sencode_coding_region);
 11846   defsubr (&Sdecode_coding_string);
 11847   defsubr (&Sencode_coding_string);
 11848 #ifdef ENABLE_UTF_8_CONVERTER_TEST
 11849   defsubr (&Sinternal_encode_string_utf_8);
 11850   defsubr (&Sinternal_decode_string_utf_8);
 11851 #endif  /* ENABLE_UTF_8_CONVERTER_TEST */
 11852   defsubr (&Sdecode_sjis_char);
 11853   defsubr (&Sencode_sjis_char);
 11854   defsubr (&Sdecode_big5_char);
 11855   defsubr (&Sencode_big5_char);
 11856   defsubr (&Sset_terminal_coding_system_internal);
 11857   defsubr (&Sset_safe_terminal_coding_system_internal);
 11858   defsubr (&Sterminal_coding_system);
 11859   defsubr (&Sset_keyboard_coding_system_internal);
 11860   defsubr (&Skeyboard_coding_system);
 11861   defsubr (&Sfind_operation_coding_system);
 11862   defsubr (&Sset_coding_system_priority);
 11863   defsubr (&Sdefine_coding_system_internal);
 11864   defsubr (&Sdefine_coding_system_alias);
 11865   defsubr (&Scoding_system_put);
 11866   defsubr (&Scoding_system_base);
 11867   defsubr (&Scoding_system_plist);
 11868   defsubr (&Scoding_system_aliases);
 11869   defsubr (&Scoding_system_eol_type);
 11870   defsubr (&Scoding_system_priority_list);
 11871 
 11872   DEFVAR_LISP ("coding-system-list", Vcoding_system_list,
 11873                doc: /* List of coding systems.
 11874 
 11875 Do not alter the value of this variable manually.  This variable should be
 11876 updated by the functions `define-coding-system' and
 11877 `define-coding-system-alias'.  */);
 11878   Vcoding_system_list = Qnil;
 11879 
 11880   DEFVAR_LISP ("coding-system-alist", Vcoding_system_alist,
 11881                doc: /* Alist of coding system names.
 11882 Each element is one element list of coding system name.
 11883 This variable is given to `completing-read' as COLLECTION argument.
 11884 
 11885 Do not alter the value of this variable manually.  This variable should be
 11886 updated by `define-coding-system-alias'.  */);
 11887   Vcoding_system_alist = Qnil;
 11888 
 11889   DEFVAR_LISP ("coding-category-list", Vcoding_category_list,
 11890                doc: /* List of coding-categories (symbols) ordered by priority.
 11891 
 11892 On detecting a coding system, Emacs tries code detection algorithms
 11893 associated with each coding-category one by one in this order.  When
 11894 one algorithm agrees with a byte sequence of source text, the coding
 11895 system bound to the corresponding coding-category is selected.
 11896 
 11897 Don't modify this variable directly, but use `set-coding-system-priority'.  */);
 11898   {
 11899     int i;
 11900 
 11901     Vcoding_category_list = Qnil;
 11902     for (i = coding_category_max - 1; i >= 0; i--)
 11903       Vcoding_category_list
 11904         = Fcons (AREF (Vcoding_category_table, i),
 11905                  Vcoding_category_list);
 11906   }
 11907 
 11908   DEFVAR_LISP ("coding-system-for-read", Vcoding_system_for_read,
 11909                doc: /* Specify the coding system for read operations.
 11910 It is useful to bind this variable with `let', but do not set it globally.
 11911 If the value is a coding system, it is used for decoding on read operation.
 11912 If not, an appropriate element is used from one of the coding system alists.
 11913 There are three such tables: `file-coding-system-alist',
 11914 `process-coding-system-alist', and `network-coding-system-alist'.  */);
 11915   Vcoding_system_for_read = Qnil;
 11916 
 11917   DEFVAR_LISP ("coding-system-for-write", Vcoding_system_for_write,
 11918                doc: /* Specify the coding system for write operations.
 11919 Programs bind this variable with `let', but you should not set it globally.
 11920 If the value is a coding system, it is used for encoding of output,
 11921 when writing it to a file and when sending it to a file or subprocess.
 11922 
 11923 If this does not specify a coding system, an appropriate element
 11924 is used from one of the coding system alists.
 11925 There are three such tables: `file-coding-system-alist',
 11926 `process-coding-system-alist', and `network-coding-system-alist'.
 11927 For output to files, if the above procedure does not specify a coding system,
 11928 the value of `buffer-file-coding-system' is used.  */);
 11929   Vcoding_system_for_write = Qnil;
 11930 
 11931   DEFVAR_LISP ("last-coding-system-used", Vlast_coding_system_used,
 11932                doc: /*
 11933 Coding system used in the latest file or process I/O.  */);
 11934   Vlast_coding_system_used = Qnil;
 11935 
 11936   DEFVAR_LISP ("last-code-conversion-error", Vlast_code_conversion_error,
 11937                doc: /*
 11938 Error status of the last code conversion.
 11939 
 11940 When an error was detected in the last code conversion, this variable
 11941 is set to one of the following symbols.
 11942   `insufficient-source'
 11943   `inconsistent-eol'
 11944   `invalid-source'
 11945   `interrupted'
 11946   `insufficient-memory'
 11947 When no error was detected, the value doesn't change.  So, to check
 11948 the error status of a code conversion by this variable, you must
 11949 explicitly set this variable to nil before performing code
 11950 conversion.  */);
 11951   Vlast_code_conversion_error = Qnil;
 11952 
 11953   DEFVAR_BOOL ("inhibit-eol-conversion", inhibit_eol_conversion,
 11954                doc: /*
 11955 Non-nil means always inhibit code conversion of end-of-line format.
 11956 See info node `Coding Systems' and info node `Text and Binary' concerning
 11957 such conversion.  */);
 11958   inhibit_eol_conversion = 0;
 11959 
 11960   DEFVAR_BOOL ("inherit-process-coding-system", inherit_process_coding_system,
 11961                doc: /*
 11962 Non-nil means process buffer inherits coding system of process output.
 11963 Bind it to t if the process output is to be treated as if it were a file
 11964 read from some filesystem.  */);
 11965   inherit_process_coding_system = 0;
 11966 
 11967   DEFVAR_LISP ("file-coding-system-alist", Vfile_coding_system_alist,
 11968                doc: /*
 11969 Alist to decide a coding system to use for a file I/O operation.
 11970 The format is ((PATTERN . VAL) ...),
 11971 where PATTERN is a regular expression matching a file name,
 11972 VAL is a coding system, a cons of coding systems, or a function symbol.
 11973 If VAL is a coding system, it is used for both decoding and encoding
 11974 the file contents.
 11975 If VAL is a cons of coding systems, the car part is used for decoding,
 11976 and the cdr part is used for encoding.
 11977 If VAL is a function symbol, the function must return a coding system
 11978 or a cons of coding systems which are used as above.  The function is
 11979 called with an argument that is a list of the arguments with which
 11980 `find-operation-coding-system' was called.  If the function can't decide
 11981 a coding system, it can return `undecided' so that the normal
 11982 code-detection is performed.
 11983 
 11984 See also the function `find-operation-coding-system'
 11985 and the variable `auto-coding-alist'.  */);
 11986   Vfile_coding_system_alist = Qnil;
 11987 
 11988   DEFVAR_LISP ("process-coding-system-alist", Vprocess_coding_system_alist,
 11989                doc: /*
 11990 Alist to decide a coding system to use for a process I/O operation.
 11991 The format is ((PATTERN . VAL) ...),
 11992 where PATTERN is a regular expression matching a program name,
 11993 VAL is a coding system, a cons of coding systems, or a function symbol.
 11994 If VAL is a coding system, it is used for both decoding what received
 11995 from the program and encoding what sent to the program.
 11996 If VAL is a cons of coding systems, the car part is used for decoding,
 11997 and the cdr part is used for encoding.
 11998 If VAL is a function symbol, the function must return a coding system
 11999 or a cons of coding systems which are used as above.
 12000 
 12001 See also the function `find-operation-coding-system'.  */);
 12002   Vprocess_coding_system_alist = Qnil;
 12003 
 12004   DEFVAR_LISP ("network-coding-system-alist", Vnetwork_coding_system_alist,
 12005                doc: /*
 12006 Alist to decide a coding system to use for a network I/O operation.
 12007 The format is ((PATTERN . VAL) ...),
 12008 where PATTERN is a regular expression matching a network service name
 12009 or is a port number to connect to,
 12010 VAL is a coding system, a cons of coding systems, or a function symbol.
 12011 If VAL is a coding system, it is used for both decoding what received
 12012 from the network stream and encoding what sent to the network stream.
 12013 If VAL is a cons of coding systems, the car part is used for decoding,
 12014 and the cdr part is used for encoding.
 12015 If VAL is a function symbol, the function must return a coding system
 12016 or a cons of coding systems which are used as above.
 12017 
 12018 See also the function `find-operation-coding-system'.  */);
 12019   Vnetwork_coding_system_alist = Qnil;
 12020 
 12021   DEFVAR_LISP ("locale-coding-system", Vlocale_coding_system,
 12022     doc: /* Coding system to use with system messages.
 12023 Potentially also used for decoding keyboard input on X Windows, and is
 12024 used for encoding standard output and error streams.  */);
 12025   Vlocale_coding_system = Qnil;
 12026 
 12027   /* The eol mnemonics are reset in startup.el system-dependently.  */
 12028   DEFVAR_LISP ("eol-mnemonic-unix", eol_mnemonic_unix,
 12029                doc: /*
 12030 String displayed in mode line for UNIX-like (LF) end-of-line format.  */);
 12031   eol_mnemonic_unix = build_pure_c_string (":");
 12032 
 12033   DEFVAR_LISP ("eol-mnemonic-dos", eol_mnemonic_dos,
 12034                doc: /*
 12035 String displayed in mode line for DOS-like (CRLF) end-of-line format.  */);
 12036   eol_mnemonic_dos = build_pure_c_string ("\\");
 12037 
 12038   DEFVAR_LISP ("eol-mnemonic-mac", eol_mnemonic_mac,
 12039                doc: /*
 12040 String displayed in mode line for MAC-like (CR) end-of-line format.  */);
 12041   eol_mnemonic_mac = build_pure_c_string ("/");
 12042 
 12043   DEFVAR_LISP ("eol-mnemonic-undecided", eol_mnemonic_undecided,
 12044                doc: /*
 12045 String displayed in mode line when end-of-line format is not yet determined.  */);
 12046   eol_mnemonic_undecided = build_pure_c_string (":");
 12047 
 12048   DEFVAR_LISP ("enable-character-translation", Venable_character_translation,
 12049                doc: /*
 12050 Non-nil enables character translation while encoding and decoding.  */);
 12051   Venable_character_translation = Qt;
 12052 
 12053   DEFVAR_LISP ("standard-translation-table-for-decode",
 12054                Vstandard_translation_table_for_decode,
 12055                doc: /* Table for translating characters while decoding.  */);
 12056   Vstandard_translation_table_for_decode = Qnil;
 12057 
 12058   DEFVAR_LISP ("standard-translation-table-for-encode",
 12059                Vstandard_translation_table_for_encode,
 12060                doc: /* Table for translating characters while encoding.  */);
 12061   Vstandard_translation_table_for_encode = Qnil;
 12062 
 12063   DEFVAR_LISP ("charset-revision-table", Vcharset_revision_table,
 12064                doc: /* Alist of charsets vs revision numbers.
 12065 While encoding, if a charset (car part of an element) is found,
 12066 designate it with the escape sequence identifying revision (cdr part
 12067 of the element).  */);
 12068   Vcharset_revision_table = Qnil;
 12069 
 12070   DEFVAR_LISP ("default-process-coding-system",
 12071                Vdefault_process_coding_system,
 12072                doc: /* Cons of coding systems used for process I/O by default.
 12073 The car part is used for decoding a process output,
 12074 the cdr part is used for encoding a text to be sent to a process.  */);
 12075   Vdefault_process_coding_system = Qnil;
 12076 
 12077   DEFVAR_LISP ("latin-extra-code-table", Vlatin_extra_code_table,
 12078                doc: /*
 12079 Table of extra Latin codes in the range 128..159 (inclusive).
 12080 This is a vector of length 256.
 12081 If Nth element is non-nil, the existence of code N in a file
 12082 \(or output of subprocess) doesn't prevent it to be detected as
 12083 a coding system of ISO 2022 variant which has a flag
 12084 `accept-latin-extra-code' t (e.g. iso-latin-1) on reading a file
 12085 or reading output of a subprocess.
 12086 Only 128th through 159th elements have a meaning.  */);
 12087   Vlatin_extra_code_table = make_nil_vector (256);
 12088 
 12089   DEFVAR_LISP ("select-safe-coding-system-function",
 12090                Vselect_safe_coding_system_function,
 12091                doc: /*
 12092 Function to call to select safe coding system for encoding a text.
 12093 
 12094 If set, this function is called to force a user to select a proper
 12095 coding system which can encode the text in the case that a default
 12096 coding system used in each operation can't encode the text.  The
 12097 function should take care that the buffer is not modified while
 12098 the coding system is being selected.
 12099 
 12100 The default value is `select-safe-coding-system' (which see).  */);
 12101   Vselect_safe_coding_system_function = Qnil;
 12102 
 12103   DEFVAR_BOOL ("coding-system-require-warning",
 12104                coding_system_require_warning,
 12105                doc: /* Internal use only.
 12106 If non-nil, on writing a file, `select-safe-coding-system-function' is
 12107 called even if `coding-system-for-write' is non-nil.  The command
 12108 `universal-coding-system-argument' binds this variable to t temporarily.  */);
 12109   coding_system_require_warning = 0;
 12110 
 12111 
 12112   DEFVAR_BOOL ("inhibit-iso-escape-detection",
 12113                inhibit_iso_escape_detection,
 12114                doc: /*
 12115 If non-nil, Emacs ignores ISO-2022 escape sequences during code detection.
 12116 
 12117 When Emacs reads text, it tries to detect how the text is encoded.
 12118 This code detection is sensitive to escape sequences.  If Emacs sees
 12119 a valid ISO-2022 escape sequence, it assumes the text is encoded in one
 12120 of the ISO2022 encodings, and decodes text by the corresponding coding
 12121 system (e.g. `iso-2022-7bit').
 12122 
 12123 However, there may be a case that you want to read escape sequences in
 12124 a file as is.  In such a case, you can set this variable to non-nil.
 12125 Then the code detection will ignore any escape sequences, and no text is
 12126 detected as encoded in some ISO-2022 encoding.  The result is that all
 12127 escape sequences become visible in a buffer.
 12128 
 12129 The default value is nil, and it is strongly recommended not to change
 12130 it.  That is because many Emacs Lisp source files that contain
 12131 non-ASCII characters are encoded by the coding system `iso-2022-7bit'
 12132 in Emacs's distribution, and they won't be decoded correctly on
 12133 reading if you suppress escape sequence detection.
 12134 
 12135 The other way to read escape sequences in a file without decoding is
 12136 to explicitly specify some coding system that doesn't use ISO-2022
 12137 escape sequence (e.g., `latin-1') on reading by \\[universal-coding-system-argument].  */);
 12138   inhibit_iso_escape_detection = 0;
 12139 
 12140   DEFVAR_BOOL ("inhibit-null-byte-detection",
 12141                inhibit_null_byte_detection,
 12142                doc: /* If non-nil, Emacs ignores null bytes on code detection.
 12143 By default, Emacs treats it as binary data, and does not attempt to
 12144 decode it.  The effect is as if you specified `no-conversion' for
 12145 reading that text.
 12146 
 12147 Set this to non-nil when a regular text happens to include null bytes.
 12148 Examples are Index nodes of Info files and null-byte delimited output
 12149 from GNU Find and GNU Grep.  Emacs will then ignore the null bytes and
 12150 decode text as usual.  */);
 12151   inhibit_null_byte_detection = 0;
 12152 
 12153   DEFVAR_BOOL ("disable-ascii-optimization", disable_ascii_optimization,
 12154                doc: /* If non-nil, Emacs does not optimize code decoder for ASCII files.
 12155 Internal use only.  Remove after the experimental optimizer becomes stable.  */);
 12156   disable_ascii_optimization = 0;
 12157 
 12158   DEFVAR_LISP ("translation-table-for-input", Vtranslation_table_for_input,
 12159                doc: /* Char table for translating self-inserting characters.
 12160 This is applied to the result of input methods, not their input.
 12161 See also `keyboard-translate-table'.
 12162 
 12163 Use of this variable for character code unification was rendered
 12164 obsolete in Emacs 23.1 and later, since Unicode is now the basis of
 12165 internal character representation.  */);
 12166   Vtranslation_table_for_input = Qnil;
 12167 
 12168   Lisp_Object args[coding_arg_undecided_max];
 12169   memclear (args, sizeof args);
 12170 
 12171   Lisp_Object plist[] =
 12172     {
 12173       QCname,
 12174       args[coding_arg_name] = Qno_conversion,
 12175       QCmnemonic,
 12176       args[coding_arg_mnemonic] = make_fixnum ('='),
 12177       intern_c_string (":coding-type"),
 12178       args[coding_arg_coding_type] = Qraw_text,
 12179       QCascii_compatible_p,
 12180       args[coding_arg_ascii_compatible_p] = Qt,
 12181       QCdefault_char,
 12182       args[coding_arg_default_char] = make_fixnum (0),
 12183       intern_c_string (":for-unibyte"),
 12184       args[coding_arg_for_unibyte] = Qt,
 12185       intern_c_string (":docstring"),
 12186       (build_pure_c_string
 12187        ("Do no conversion.\n"
 12188         "\n"
 12189         "When you visit a file with this coding, the file is read into a\n"
 12190         "unibyte buffer as is, thus each byte of a file is treated as a\n"
 12191         "character.")),
 12192       intern_c_string (":eol-type"),
 12193       args[coding_arg_eol_type] = Qunix,
 12194     };
 12195   args[coding_arg_plist] = CALLMANY (Flist, plist);
 12196   Fdefine_coding_system_internal (coding_arg_max, args);
 12197 
 12198   plist[1] = args[coding_arg_name] = Qundecided;
 12199   plist[3] = args[coding_arg_mnemonic] = make_fixnum ('-');
 12200   plist[5] = args[coding_arg_coding_type] = Qundecided;
 12201   /* This is already set.
 12202      plist[7] = args[coding_arg_ascii_compatible_p] = Qt; */
 12203   plist[8] = intern_c_string (":charset-list");
 12204   plist[9] = args[coding_arg_charset_list] = list1 (Qascii);
 12205   plist[11] = args[coding_arg_for_unibyte] = Qnil;
 12206   plist[13] = build_pure_c_string ("No conversion on encoding, "
 12207                                    "automatic conversion on decoding.");
 12208   plist[15] = args[coding_arg_eol_type] = Qnil;
 12209   args[coding_arg_plist] = CALLMANY (Flist, plist);
 12210   args[coding_arg_undecided_inhibit_null_byte_detection] = make_fixnum (0);
 12211   args[coding_arg_undecided_inhibit_iso_escape_detection] = make_fixnum (0);
 12212   Fdefine_coding_system_internal (coding_arg_undecided_max, args);
 12213 
 12214   setup_coding_system (Qno_conversion, &safe_terminal_coding);
 12215 
 12216   for (int i = 0; i < coding_category_max; i++)
 12217     Fset (AREF (Vcoding_category_table, i), Qno_conversion);
 12218 
 12219   pdumper_do_now_and_after_load (reset_coding_after_pdumper_load);
 12220 }
 12221 
 12222 static void
 12223 reset_coding_after_pdumper_load (void)
 12224 {
 12225   if (!dumped_with_pdumper_p ())
 12226     return;
 12227   for (struct coding_system *this = &coding_categories[0];
 12228        this < &coding_categories[coding_category_max];
 12229        ++this)
 12230     {
 12231       int id = this->id;
 12232       if (id >= 0)
 12233         {
 12234           /* Need to rebuild the coding system object because we
 12235              persisted it as a scalar and it's full of gunk that's now
 12236              invalid.  */
 12237           memset (this, 0, sizeof (*this));
 12238           setup_coding_system (CODING_ID_NAME (id), this);
 12239         }
 12240     }
 12241   /* In temacs the below is done by mule-conf.el, because we need to
 12242      define us-ascii first.  But in dumped Emacs us-ascii is restored
 12243      by the above loop, and mule-conf.el will not be loaded, so we set
 12244      it up now; otherwise safe_terminal_coding will remain zeroed.  */
 12245   Fset_safe_terminal_coding_system_internal (Qus_ascii);
 12246 }
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
